 263+ AAC3 4F                                   ld c,a
 264+ AAC4 C9                                   ret
 265+ AAC5
 266+ AAC5              ;Inputs:
 267+ AAC5              ;     DE,BC are 8.8 Fixed Point numbers
 268+ AAC5              ;Outputs:
 269+ AAC5              ;     DE is the 8.8 Fixed Point result (rounded to the least significant bit)
 270+ AAC5              ;if DE is 0 : 122cc or 136cc if BC is negative
 271+ AAC5              ;if |BC|>=128*|DE| : 152cc or 166cc if BC is negative
 272+ AAC5              ;Otherwise:
 273+ AAC5              ;min: 1107cc
 274+ AAC5              ;max: 1319cc
 275+ AAC5              ;avg: 1201cc
 276+ AAC5 78           BC_Div_DE_88:           ld a,b  ; First, find out if the output is positive or negative
 277+ AAC6 AA                                   xor d
 278+ AAC7 F5                                   push af   ;sign bit is the result sign bit
 279+ AAC8              ; Now make sure the inputs are positive
 280+ AAC8 A8                                   xor b     ;A now has the value of B, since I XORed it with D twice (cancelling)
 281+ AAC9 F2 D2 AA                             jp p,BC_Div_DE_88_lbl1   ;if Positive, don't negate
 282+ AACC AF                                   xor a
 283+ AACD 91                                   sub c
 284+ AACE 4F                                   ld c,a
 285+ AACF 9F                                   sbc a,a
 286+ AAD0 90                                   sub b
 287+ AAD1 47                                   ld b,a
 288+ AAD2 7A           BC_Div_DE_88_lbl1:      ld a,d  ;now make DE negative to optimize the remainder comparison
 289+ AAD3 B2                                   or d
 290+ AAD4 FA DD AA                             jp m,BC_Div_DE_88_lbl2
 291+ AAD7 AF                                   xor a
 292+ AAD8 93                                   sub e
 293+ AAD9 5F                                   ld e,a
 294+ AADA 9F                                   sbc a,a
 295+ AADB 92                                   sub d
 296+ AADC 57                                   ld d,a
 297+ AADD B3           BC_Div_DE_88_lbl2:      or e      ;if DE is 0, we can call it an overflow ;A is the current value of D
 298+ AADE 28 1D                                jr z,div_fixed88_overflow
 299+ AAE0 26 00                                ld h,0          ;The accumulator gets set to B if no overflow.;We can use H=0 to save a few cc in the meantime
 300+ AAE2 78                                   ld a,b;if B+DE>=0, then we'll have overflow
 301+ AAE3 83                                   add a,e
 302+ AAE4 7A                                   ld a,d
 303+ AAE5 8C                                   adc a,h
 304+ AAE6 38 15                                jr c,div_fixed88_overflow
 305+ AAE8 68                                   ld l,b  ;Now we can load the accumulator/remainder with B;H is already 0
 306+ AAE9 79                                   ld a,c
 307+ AAEA CD 05 AB                             call div_fixed88_sub
 308+ AAED 4F                                   ld c,a
 309+ AAEE 78                                   ld a,b      ;A is now 0
 310+ AAEF CD 05 AB                             call div_fixed88_sub
 311+ AAF2 51                                   ld d,c
 312+ AAF3 5F                                   ld e,a
 313+ AAF4 F1                                   pop af
 314+ AAF5 F0                                   ret p
 315+ AAF6 AF                                   xor a
 316+ AAF7 93                                   sub e
 317+ AAF8 5F                                   ld e,a
 318+ AAF9 9F                                   sbc a,a
 319+ AAFA 92                                   sub d
 320+ AAFB 57                                   ld d,a
 321+ AAFC C9                                   ret
 322+ AAFD
 323+ AAFD 11 FF 7F     div_fixed88_overflow:   ld de,$7FFF
 324+ AB00 F1                                   pop af
 325+ AB01 F0                                   ret p
 326+ AB02 13                                   inc de
 327+ AB03 1C                                   inc e
 328+ AB04 C9                                   ret
 329+ AB05
 330+ AB05              ;min: 456cc
 331+ AB05              ;max: 536cc
 332+ AB05              ;avg: 496cc
 333+ AB05 06 08        div_fixed88_sub:        ld b,8
 334+ AB07 17           BC_Div_DE_88_lbl3:      rla
 335+ AB08 ED 6A                                adc hl,hl
 336+ AB0A 19                                   add hl,de
 337+ AB0B 38 02                                jr c,$+4
 338+ AB0D ED 52                                sbc hl,de
 339+ AB0F 10 F6                                djnz BC_Div_DE_88_lbl3
 340+ AB11 8F                                   adc a,a
 341+ AB12 C9                                   ret
 342+ AB13
# file closed: ./Maths/asm_divide.asm
1034  AB13                  INCLUDE "./Maths/asm_unitvector.asm"
# file opened: ./Maths/asm_unitvector.asm
   1+ AB13              asm_tis2:
   2+ AB13              ; ">TIS2 A = (A / Q * 96) so A = -96 ---- 96  range "
   3+ AB13              ; ">DOES NOT DO SIGNED YET"
   4+ AB13 F5           	push af
   5+ AB14 E6 7F            and SignMask8Bit
   6+ AB16 57           	ld d,a				;; d = A
   7+ AB17 3A BF 97     	ld a,(varQ)
   8+ AB1A 5F           	ld e,a
   9+ AB1B 7A           	ld a,d
  10+ AB1C BB           	cp e
  11+ AB1D 30 11        	jr nc, .tis2_set96	;; jump if a >= Q
  12+ AB1F 1E 60        	ld e, 96
  13+ AB21 ED 30        	mul				; de = d * 96 (also a * 96 )
  14+ AB23 EB           	ex de,hl
  15+ AB24 3A BF 97     	ld a,(varQ)
  16+ AB27 4F           	ld c,a
  17+ AB28 CD 00 AA     	call asm_div16
  18+ AB2B F1           	pop af
  19+ AB2C E6 80        	and $80
  20+ AB2E B5           	or l
  21+ AB2F C9           	ret
  22+ AB30              .tis2_set96:
  23+ AB30 F1           	pop af
  24+ AB31 E6 80        	and $80
  25+ AB33 F6 96        	or $96
  26+ AB35 C9           	ret
  27+ AB36
  28+ AB36
  29+ AB36              asm_unit_vector:
  30+ AB36              squareregfx:
  31+ AB36 3A 79 C0     	ld a,(UBnkXScaled)
  32+ AB39 57           	ld d,a
  33+ AB3A 5F           	ld e,a
  34+ AB3B ED 30        	mul
  35+ AB3D EB           	ex de,hl
  36+ AB3E              squareregfy:
  37+ AB3E 3A 7B C0     	ld a, (UBnkYScaled)
  38+ AB41 57           	ld d,a
  39+ AB42 5F           	ld e,a
  40+ AB43 ED 30        	mul
  41+ AB45 19           	add hl,de
  42+ AB46              squareregfz:
  43+ AB46 3A 7D C0     	ld a, (UBnkZScaled)
  44+ AB49 57           	ld d,a
  45+ AB4A 5F           	ld e,a
  46+ AB4B ED 30        	mul
  47+ AB4D 19           	add hl,de
  48+ AB4E EB           	ex de,hl			; de de to number to root
  49+ AB4F              hlequsquareroot:
  50+ AB4F CD E1 A8     	call asm_sqrt		; hl = sqrt (fx^2 + fy^2 + fx^2)
  51+ AB52 E5           	push hl				; save it for work 3 copies
  52+ AB53 E5           	push hl				; save it for work
  53+ AB54 E5           	push hl				; save it for work
  54+ AB55              normfx:
  55+ AB55 3A 79 C0     	ld a,(UBnkXScaled)
  56+ AB58 E1           	pop hl				; get copy #1
  57+ AB59 7D           	ld a,l				; we assume only l had worthwhile data but could spill into h
  58+ AB5A 4F           	ld c,a
  59+ AB5B CD 13 AB     	call asm_tis2
  60+ AB5E 32 79 C0     	ld (UBnkXScaled),a
  61+ AB61              normfy:
  62+ AB61 3A 7B C0     	ld a,(UBnkYScaled)
  63+ AB64 E1           	pop hl				; get copy #2
  64+ AB65 7D           	ld a,l
  65+ AB66 4F           	ld c,a
  66+ AB67 CD 13 AB     	call asm_tis2
  67+ AB6A 32 7B C0     	ld (UBnkYScaled),a
  68+ AB6D              normfz:
  69+ AB6D 3A 7D C0     	ld a,(UBnkZScaled)
  70+ AB70 E1           	pop hl				; get copy #2
  71+ AB71 7D           	ld a,l
  72+ AB72 4F           	ld c,a
  73+ AB73 CD 13 AB     	call asm_tis2
  74+ AB76 32 7D C0     	ld (UBnkZScaled),a
  75+ AB79              asm_unit_vector_end:
  76+ AB79 C9           	ret
  77+ AB7A
# file closed: ./Maths/asm_unitvector.asm
1035  AB7A                  INCLUDE "./Maths/compare16.asm"
# file opened: ./Maths/compare16.asm
   1+ AB7A              ; Input:
   2+ AB7A              ;       HL = 1st value
   3+ AB7A              ;       DE = 2nd value
   4+ AB7A              ; Output:
   5+ AB7A              ;       CF, ZF = results of comparison:
   6+ AB7A              ;
   7+ AB7A              ;               CF      ZF      Result
   8+ AB7A              ;               -----------------------------------
   9+ AB7A              ;               0       0       HL > DE
  10+ AB7A              ;               0       1       HL == DE
  11+ AB7A              ;               1       0       HL < DE
  12+ AB7A              ;               1       1       Impossible
  13+ AB7A              ;
  14+ AB7A
  15+ AB7A E5           compare16HLDE:      push    hl
  16+ AB7B A7                               and     a
  17+ AB7C ED 52                            sbc     hl,de
  18+ AB7E E1                               pop     hl
  19+ AB7F C9                               ret
  20+ AB80
  21+ AB80              ; With compare signed we do ABS comparison
  22+ AB80              ; this is used for view ports as we just want to know if its +/- out side of 90 degrees
  23+ AB80
  24+ AB80 E5 D5        compare16HLDEABS:   push    hl,,de
  25+ AB82 7C                               ld      a,h                                     ; Quick pass see of both the same sign
  26+ AB83 E6 7F                            and     SignMask8Bit
  27+ AB85 67                               ld      h,a
  28+ AB86 7A                               ld      a,d                                     ; Quick pass see of both the same sign
  29+ AB87 E6 7F                            and     SignMask8Bit
  30+ AB89 57                               ld      d,a
  31+ AB8A A7                               and     a
  32+ AB8B ED 52                            sbc     hl,de
  33+ AB8D D1 E1                            pop     hl,,de
  34+ AB8F C9                               ret
  35+ AB90
  36+ AB90
# file closed: ./Maths/compare16.asm
1036  AB90                  INCLUDE "./Maths/negate16.asm"
# file opened: ./Maths/negate16.asm
   1+ AB90              ;;----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
   2+ AB90              ;; 16-bit negate
   3+ AB90              negate16:
   4+ AB90              negate16hl:
   5+ AB90                      ; Input:
   6+ AB90                      ;       HL = value
   7+ AB90                      ; Output:
   8+ AB90                      ;       HL = -value
   9+ AB90                      ; Destroys:
  10+ AB90                      ;       AF
  11+ AB90                      ;
  12+ AB90 AF           	xor 	a
  13+ AB91 95           	sub 	l
  14+ AB92 6F           	ld 		l,a
  15+ AB93 9F           	sbc 	a,a
  16+ AB94 94           	sub 	h
  17+ AB95 67           	ld 		h,a
  18+ AB96 C9           	ret
  19+ AB97
  20+ AB97              negate16de:
  21+ AB97 AF           	xor 	a
  22+ AB98 93           	sub 	e
  23+ AB99 5F           	ld 		e,a
  24+ AB9A 9F           	sbc 	a,a
  25+ AB9B 92           	sub 	d
  26+ AB9C 57           	ld 		d,a
  27+ AB9D C9           	ret
  28+ AB9E
  29+ AB9E              negate16bc:
  30+ AB9E AF           	xor 	a
  31+ AB9F 91           	sub 	c
  32+ ABA0 4F           	ld 		c,a
  33+ ABA1 9F           	sbc 	a,a
  34+ ABA2 90           	sub 	b
  35+ ABA3 47           	ld 		b,a
  36+ ABA4 C9           	ret
  37+ ABA5
  38+ ABA5
  39+ ABA5              macronegate16hl:	MACRO
  40+ ABA5 ~            					xor 	a
  41+ ABA5 ~            					sub 	l
  42+ ABA5 ~            					ld 		l,a
  43+ ABA5 ~            					sbc 	a,a
  44+ ABA5 ~            					sub 	h
  45+ ABA5 ~            					ld 		h,a
  46+ ABA5              					ENDM
  47+ ABA5
  48+ ABA5              macronegate16de:	MACRO
  49+ ABA5 ~            					xor 	a
  50+ ABA5 ~                                sub 	e
  51+ ABA5 ~                                ld 		e,a
  52+ ABA5 ~                                sbc 	a,a
  53+ ABA5 ~                                sub 	d
  54+ ABA5 ~                                ld 		d,a
  55+ ABA5              					ENDM
  56+ ABA5              macronegate16bc:	MACRO
  57+ ABA5 ~            					xor 	a
  58+ ABA5 ~                                sub 	c
  59+ ABA5 ~                                ld 		c,a
  60+ ABA5 ~                                sbc 	a,a
  61+ ABA5 ~                                sub 	b
  62+ ABA5 ~                                ld 		b,a
  63+ ABA5              					ENDM
  64+ ABA5
  65+ ABA5              macronegate16ix:	MACRO
  66+ ABA5 ~            					xor 	a
  67+ ABA5 ~                                sub 	ixl
  68+ ABA5 ~                                ld 		ixl,a
  69+ ABA5 ~                                sbc 	a,a
  70+ ABA5 ~                                sub 	ixh
  71+ ABA5 ~                                ld 		ixh,a
  72+ ABA5              					ENDM
# file closed: ./Maths/negate16.asm
1037  ABA5                  INCLUDE "./Maths/normalise96.asm"
# file opened: ./Maths/normalise96.asm
   1+ ABA5 DD 68        AequAdivDmul96Unsg:     ld			ixl,b						; Get sign bit passed in as bit 7 in b
   2+ ABA7                                      JumpIfAGTENusng d, TISXAccGTEQ			; if A >= Q then return with a 1 (unity i.e. 96) with the correct sign
   2+ ABA7 BA          >                        cp     d
   2+ ABA8 D2 BD AB    >                        jp		nc,TISXAccGTEQ
   3+ ABAB 4F                                   ld			c,a
   4+ ABAC CD F2 A9                             call		asm_div8
   5+ ABAF 79                                   ld			a,c							; a = result
   6+ ABB0 CB 3F                                srl			a							; result / 4
   7+ ABB2 47                                   ld			b,a							; t = t /4
   8+ ABB3 CB 3F                                srl			a							; result / 8
   9+ ABB5 80                                   add			a,b							; result /8 + result /4
  10+ ABB6 47                                   ld			b,a							; b = 3/8*Acc (max = 96)
  11+ ABB7 DD 7D                                ld			a,ixl						; copy of Acc to look at sign bit
  12+ ABB9 E6 80                                and			$80							; recover sign only
  13+ ABBB B0                                   or			b							; now put b back in so we have a leading sign bit (note not 2's compliment)
  14+ ABBC C9                                   ret
  15+ ABBD              TISXAccGTEQ:
  16+ ABBD              ;TI4:										;\ clean to +/- unity
  17+ ABBD DD 7D                                ld			a,ixl     					; get saved sign from b
  18+ ABBF E6 80                                and			$80							; copy of Acc
  19+ ABC1 F6 60                                or			$60							; unity
  20+ ABC3 C9                                   ret
  21+ ABC4
  22+ ABC4
  23+ ABC4
  24+ ABC4
  25+ ABC4              normaliseXX1596fast:
  26+ ABC4                  ; .NORM	\ -> &3BD6 \ Normalize 3-vector length of XX15
  27+ ABC4 3A 79 C0     	ld		a,(XX15)		    ; XX15+0
  28+ ABC7 DD 67        	ld		ixh,a               ; ixh = signed x component
  29+ ABC9 E6 7F        	and		SignMask8Bit                 ; a = unsigned version
  30+ ABCB              N96SQX:
  31+ ABCB              	inline_squde				; Use inline square for speed	objective is SQUA \ P.A =A7*A7 x^2
  31+ ABCB 5F          >			ld	e,a
  31+ ABCC 57          >			ld  d,a
  31+ ABCD ED 30       >			mul
  32+ ABCF 62           	ld		h,d					; h == varR d = varO e= varA
  33+ ABD0 6B           	ld		l,e					; l == varQ  															:: so HL = XX15[x]^2
  34+ ABD1              N96SQY:
  35+ ABD1 3A 7A C0     	ld		a,(XX15+1)
  36+ ABD4 DD 6F        	ld		ixl,a               ; ixl = signed y componet
  37+ ABD6 E6 7F        	and		SignMask8Bit                 ; = abs
  38+ ABD8              	inline_squde				; Use inline square for speed	objective is SQUA \ P.A =A7*A7 x^2		:: so DE = XX15[y]^2
  38+ ABD8 5F          >			ld	e,a
  38+ ABD9 57          >			ld  d,a
  38+ ABDA ED 30       >			mul
  39+ ABDC 19           	add		hl,de				; hl = XX15[x]^2 + XX15[y]^2
  40+ ABDD              N96SQZ:
  41+ ABDD 3A 7B C0     	ld		a,(XX15+2)			; Note comments say \ ZZ15+2  should be \ XX15+2 as per code
  42+ ABE0 FD 67        	ld		iyh,a               ; iyh = signed
  43+ ABE2 E6 7F        	and		SignMask8Bit                 ; unsigned
  44+ ABE4              	inline_squde				; Use inline square for speed	objective is SQUA \ P.A =A7*A7 x^2		:: so DE = XX15[z]^2
  44+ ABE4 5F          >			ld	e,a
  44+ ABE5 57          >			ld  d,a
  44+ ABE6 ED 30       >			mul
  45+ ABE8              N96SQADD:
  46+ ABE8 19           	add		hl,de				; hl = XX15[x]^2 + XX15[y]^2 + XX15[z]^2
  47+ ABE9 EB           	ex		de,hl				; hl => de ready for square root
  48+ ABEA              N96SQRT:
  49+ ABEA CD E1 A8     	call	asm_sqrt			; hl = sqrt(XX15[x]^2 + XX15[y]^2 + XX15[z]^2), we just are interested in l which is the new Q
  50+ ABED              N96NORMX:
  51+ ABED 3A 79 C0     	ld		a,(XX15+0)
  52+ ABF0 E6 7F        	and		SignMask8Bit
  53+ ABF2 4F           	ld		c,a
  54+ ABF3 55           	ld		d,l					; Q(i.e. l) => D, later we can just pop into de
  55+ ABF4 CD 1B AE     	call	AequAdivDmul96	; does not use HL so we can retain it
  56+ ABF7 47           	ld		b,a				;++SGN
  57+ ABF8 DD 7C        	ld		a,ixh			;++SGN
  58+ ABFA E6 80        	and		$80				;++SGN
  59+ ABFC B0           	or		b				;++SGN
  60+ ABFD 32 79 C0     	ld		(XX15+0),a
  61+ AC00              N96NORMY:
  62+ AC00 3A 7A C0     	ld		a,(XX15+1)
  63+ AC03 E6 7F        	and		SignMask8Bit
  64+ AC05 4F           	ld		c,a
  65+ AC06 55           	ld		d,l					; Q(i.e. l) => D, later we can just pop into de
  66+ AC07 CD 1B AE     	call	AequAdivDmul96     	; does not use HL so we can retain it
  67+ AC0A 47           	ld		b,a				;++SGN
  68+ AC0B DD 7D        	ld		a,ixl			;++SGN
  69+ AC0D E6 80        	and		$80				;++SGN
  70+ AC0F B0           	or		b				;++SGN
  71+ AC10 32 7A C0     	ld		(XX15+1),a
  72+ AC13              N96NORMZ:
  73+ AC13 3A 7B C0     	ld		a,(XX15+2)
  74+ AC16 E6 7F        	and		SignMask8Bit
  75+ AC18 4F           	ld		c,a
  76+ AC19 55           	ld		d,l					; Q(i.e. l) => D, later we can just pop into de
  77+ AC1A CD 1B AE     	call	AequAdivDmul96	; does not use HL so we can retain it
  78+ AC1D 47           	ld		b,a				;++SGN
  79+ AC1E FD 7C        	ld		a,iyh			;++SGN
  80+ AC20 E6 80        	and		$80				;++SGN
  81+ AC22 B0           	or		b				;++SGN
  82+ AC23 32 7B C0     	ld		(XX15+2),a
  83+ AC26 C9           	ret
  84+ AC27
  85+ AC27              ; Normalise vector
  86+ AC27              ; scale Q = Sqrt (X^2 + Y^2 + Z^2)
  87+ AC27              ; X = X / Q with 96 = 1 , i.e X = X / Q * 3/8
  88+ AC27              ; Y = Y / Q with 96 = 1 , i.e Y = Y / Q * 3/8
  89+ AC27              ; Z = Z / Q with 96 = 1 , i.e Z = Z / Q * 3/8
  90+ AC27              ;
  91+ AC27              ;
  92+ AC27              ;
  93+ AC27
  94+ AC27              ; .NORM	\ -> &3BD6 \ Normalize 3-vector length of XX15
  95+ AC27 3A 79 C0     normaliseXX1596:        ld		a,(XX15)		    ; XX15+0
  96+ AC2A                                      inline_squde				; Use inline square for speed	objective is SQUA \ P.A =A7*A7 x^2
  96+ AC2A 5F          >			ld	e,a
  96+ AC2B 57          >			ld  d,a
  96+ AC2C ED 30       >			mul
  97+ AC2E 7A                                   ld		a,d
  98+ AC2F 32 C0 97                             ld		(varR),a			; R	 \ hi sum later use b
  99+ AC32 7B                                   ld		a,e
 100+ AC33 32 BF 97                             ld		(varQ),a			; Q	 \ lo sum later use c
 101+ AC36 32 AE 96                             ld		(varP),a			; P	 \ lo sum later just drop
 102+ AC39 3A 7A C0                             ld		a,(XX15+1)
 103+ AC3C                                      inline_squde				; Use inline square for speed	objective is SQUA \ P.A =A7*A7 x^2
 103+ AC3C 5F          >			ld	e,a
 103+ AC3D 57          >			ld  d,a
 103+ AC3E ED 30       >			mul
 104+ AC40 7A                                   ld		a,d
 105+ AC41 32 DC 97                             ld		(varT),a			; T	 \ hi sum
 106+ AC44 7B                                   ld		a,e
 107+ AC45 32 AE 96                             ld		(varP),a			; P	 \ lo sum
 108+ AC48 21 BF 97                             ld		hl,varQ
 109+ AC4B 8E                                   adc		a,(hl)				; +Q
 110+ AC4C 32 BF 97                             ld		(varQ),a			; =>Q
 111+ AC4F 3A DC 97                             ld		a,(varT)			;
 112+ AC52 21 C0 97                             ld		hl,varR
 113+ AC55 8E                                   adc		a,(hl)				;  R
 114+ AC56 32 C0 97                             ld		(varR),a			; R
 115+ AC59 3A 7B C0                             ld		a,(XX15+2)			; Note comments say \ ZZ15+2  should be \ XX15+2 as per code
 116+ AC5C                                      inline_squde				; Use inline square for speed	objective is SQUA \ P.A =A7*A7 x^2
 116+ AC5C 5F          >			ld	e,a
 116+ AC5D 57          >			ld  d,a
 116+ AC5E ED 30       >			mul
 117+ AC60 7A                                   ld		a,d
 118+ AC61 32 DC 97                             ld		(varT),a			; T	 \ hi sum
 119+ AC64 7B                                   ld		a,e
 120+ AC65 32 AE 96                             ld		(varP),a			; P	 \ lo sum
 121+ AC68 21 BF 97                             ld		hl,varQ
 122+ AC6B 8E                                   adc		a,(hl)				; +Q
 123+ AC6C 32 BF 97                             ld		(varQ),a			; =>Q  xlo2 + ylo2 + zlo2
 124+ AC6F 3A DC 97                             ld		a,(varT)			; T temp Hi
 125+ AC72 21 C0 97                             ld		hl,varR
 126+ AC75 8E                                   adc		a,(hl)				; +R
 127+ AC76 32 C0 97                             ld		(varR),a			; R
 128+ AC79 CD 04 A9                             call	sqrtQR				; Q = SQR(Qlo.Rhi) Q <~127
 129+ AC7C 3A 79 C0                             ld		a,(XX15+0)
 130+ AC7F CD 15 AE                             call	AequAdivQmul96		;  TIS2 \ *96/Q
 131+ AC82 32 79 C0                             ld		(XX15+0),a
 132+ AC85 3A 7A C0                             ld		a,(XX15+1)
 133+ AC88 CD 15 AE                             call	AequAdivQmul96		;  TIS2 \ *96/Q
 134+ AC8B 32 7A C0                             ld		(XX15+1),a
 135+ AC8E 3A 7A C0                             ld		a,(XX15+1)
 136+ AC91 CD 15 AE                             call	AequAdivQmul96		;  TIS2 \ *96/Q
 137+ AC94 32 7A C0                             ld		(XX15+1),a
 138+ AC97 C9                                   ret
 139+ AC98
 140+ AC98
# file closed: ./Maths/normalise96.asm
1038  AC98                  INCLUDE "./Maths/binary_to_decimal.asm"
# file opened: ./Maths/binary_to_decimal.asm
   1+ AC98              ;Number in hl to decimal ASCII
   2+ AC98              ;Thanks to z80 Bits
   3+ AC98              ;inputs:	hl = number to ASCII
   4+ AC98              ;example: hl=300 outputs '00300'
   5+ AC98              ;destroys: af, bc, hl, de used
   6+ AC98              DispHLtoDE:
   7+ AC98              ; "DispHL, writes HL to DE address"
   8+ AC98 01 F0 D8     	ld	bc,-10000
   9+ AC9B CD B1 AC     	call	Num1
  10+ AC9E 01 18 FC     	ld	bc,-1000
  11+ ACA1 CD B1 AC     	call	Num1
  12+ ACA4 01 9C FF     	ld	bc,-100
  13+ ACA7 CD B1 AC     	call	Num1
  14+ ACAA 0E F6        	ld	c,-10
  15+ ACAC CD B1 AC     	call	Num1
  16+ ACAF 0E FF        	ld	c,-1
  17+ ACB1              Num1:
  18+ ACB1 3E 2F        	ld	a,'0'-1
  19+ ACB3              .Num2:
  20+ ACB3 3C           	inc	a
  21+ ACB4 09           	add	hl,bc
  22+ ACB5 38 FC        	jr	c,.Num2
  23+ ACB7 ED 42        	sbc	hl,bc
  24+ ACB9 12           	ld	(de),a
  25+ ACBA 13           	inc	de
  26+ ACBB C9           	ret
  27+ ACBC
  28+ ACBC              DispAtoDE:
  29+ ACBC 26 00        	ld h,0
  30+ ACBE 6F           	ld l,a
  31+ ACBF C3 98 AC     	jp DispHLtoDE
  32+ ACC2
  33+ ACC2              DispPriceAtoDE:
  34+ ACC2 26 00        	ld h,0
  35+ ACC4 6F           	ld l,a
  36+ ACC5 01 9C FF     	ld	bc,-100
  37+ ACC8 CD D8 AC     	call	.NumLeadBlank1
  38+ ACCB 0E F6        	ld	c,-10
  39+ ACCD CD B1 AC     	call	Num1
  40+ ACD0 3E 2E        	ld		a,'.'					; we could assume preformat but
  41+ ACD2 12           	ld		(de),a					; we can optimse that later TODO
  42+ ACD3 13           	inc		de						; with just an inc De
  43+ ACD4 0E FF        	ld	c,-1
  44+ ACD6 18 D9        	jr		Num1
  45+ ACD8              .NumLeadBlank1:
  46+ ACD8 3E 2F        	ld	a,'0'-1
  47+ ACDA              .NumLeadBlank2:
  48+ ACDA 3C           	inc	a
  49+ ACDB 09           	add	hl,bc
  50+ ACDC 38 FC        	jr	c,.NumLeadBlank2
  51+ ACDE FE 30        	cp	'0'
  52+ ACE0 20 02        	jr	nz,.DontBlank
  53+ ACE2              .Blank:
  54+ ACE2 3E 20        	ld	a,' '
  55+ ACE4              .DontBlank:
  56+ ACE4 ED 42        	sbc	hl,bc
  57+ ACE6 12           	ld	(de),a
  58+ ACE7 13           	inc	de
  59+ ACE8 C9           	ret
  60+ ACE9
  61+ ACE9              DispQtyAtoDE:
  62+ ACE9 FE 00        	cp	0
  63+ ACEB 28 23        	jr	z,.NoStock
  64+ ACED 26 00        	ld h,0
  65+ ACEF 6F           	ld l,a
  66+ ACF0 01 9C FF     	ld	bc,-100
  67+ ACF3 CD FF AC     	call	.NumLeadBlank1
  68+ ACF6 0E F6        	ld	c,-10
  69+ ACF8 CD FF AC     	call	.NumLeadBlank1
  70+ ACFB 0E FF        	ld	c,-1
  71+ ACFD 18 B2        	jr		Num1
  72+ ACFF              .NumLeadBlank1:
  73+ ACFF 3E 2F        	ld	a,'0'-1
  74+ AD01              .NumLeadBlank2:
  75+ AD01 3C           	inc	a
  76+ AD02 09           	add	hl,bc
  77+ AD03 38 FC        	jr	c,.NumLeadBlank2
  78+ AD05 FE 30        	cp	'0'
  79+ AD07 20 02        	jr	nz,.DontBlank
  80+ AD09              .Blank:
  81+ AD09 3E 20        	ld	a,' '
  82+ AD0B              .DontBlank:
  83+ AD0B ED 42        	sbc	hl,bc
  84+ AD0D 12           	ld	(de),a
  85+ AD0E 13           	inc	de
  86+ AD0F C9           	ret
  87+ AD10              .NoStock:
  88+ AD10 3E 20        	ld	a,' '
  89+ AD12 12           	ld	(de),a
  90+ AD13 13           	inc	de
  91+ AD14 12           	ld	(de),a
  92+ AD15 13           	inc	de
  93+ AD16 3E 2D        	ld	a,'-'
  94+ AD18 12           	ld	(de),a
  95+ AD19 13           	inc de
  96+ AD1A C9           	ret
  97+ AD1B
  98+ AD1B
  99+ AD1B              ;### CLCN32 -> Converts 32Bit-Value in ASCII-String (terminated by 0)
 100+ AD1B              ;### Input      DE,IX=32bit value, IY=destination address
 101+ AD1B              ;### Output     IY=last char in destination string
 102+ AD1B              ;### Destroyed AF,BC,DE,HL,IX
 103+ AD1B 01 00 00 00  clcn32t dw 1,0,     10,0,     100,0,     1000,0,       10000,0
 103+ AD1F 0A 00 00 00
 103+ AD23 64 00 00 00
 103+ AD27 E8 03 00 00
 103+ AD2B 10 27 00 00
 104+ AD2F A0 86 01 00          dw $86a0,1, $4240,$0f, $9680,$98, $e100,$05f5, $ca00,$3b9a
 104+ AD33 40 42 0F 00
 104+ AD37 80 96 98 00
 104+ AD3B 00 E1 F5 05
 104+ AD3F 00 CA 9A 3B
 105+ AD43 00 00 00 00  clcn32z ds 4
 106+ AD47
 107+ AD47              ; As per display but shifts final digit by 1 and puts in "." for 1 decimal place
 108+ AD47 CD 56 AD     DispDEIXtoIY1DP:        call    DispDEIXtoIY
 109+ AD4A FD 7E 00                             ld      a,(IY+0)
 110+ AD4D FD 77 01                             ld      (IY+1),a
 111+ AD50 3E 2E                                ld      a,"."
 112+ AD52 FD 77 00                             ld      (IY+0),a
 113+ AD55 C9                                   ret
 114+ AD56
 115+ AD56 DD 22 43 AD  DispDEIXtoIY:           ld (clcn32z),ix
 116+ AD5A ED 53 45 AD                          ld (clcn32z+2),de
 117+ AD5E DD 21 3F AD                          ld ix,clcn32t+36
 118+ AD62 06 09                                ld b,9
 119+ AD64 0E 00                                ld c,0
 120+ AD66 3E 30        .clcn321:               ld a,'0'
 121+ AD68 B7                                   or a
 122+ AD69 DD 5E 00     .clcn322:               ld e,(ix+0)
 123+ AD6C DD 56 01                             ld d,(ix+1)
 124+ AD6F 2A 43 AD                             ld hl,(clcn32z)
 125+ AD72 ED 52                                sbc hl,de
 126+ AD74 22 43 AD                             ld (clcn32z),hl
 127+ AD77 DD 5E 02                             ld e,(ix+2)
 128+ AD7A DD 56 03                             ld d,(ix+3)
 129+ AD7D 2A 45 AD                             ld hl,(clcn32z+2)
 130+ AD80 ED 52                                sbc hl,de
 131+ AD82 22 45 AD                             ld (clcn32z+2),hl
 132+ AD85 38 04                                jr c,.clcn325
 133+ AD87 0C                                   inc c
 134+ AD88 3C                                   inc a
 135+ AD89 18 DE                                jr .clcn322
 136+ AD8B DD 5E 00     .clcn325:               ld e,(ix+0)
 137+ AD8E DD 56 01                             ld d,(ix+1)
 138+ AD91 2A 43 AD                             ld hl,(clcn32z)
 139+ AD94 19                                   add hl,de
 140+ AD95 22 43 AD                             ld (clcn32z),hl
 141+ AD98 DD 5E 02                             ld e,(ix+2)
 142+ AD9B DD 56 03                             ld d,(ix+3)
 143+ AD9E 2A 45 AD                             ld hl,(clcn32z+2)
 144+ ADA1 ED 5A                                adc hl,de
 145+ ADA3 22 45 AD                             ld (clcn32z+2),hl
 146+ ADA6 11 FC FF                             ld de,-4
 147+ ADA9 DD 19                                add ix,de
 148+ ADAB 0C                                   inc c
 149+ ADAC 0D                                   dec c
 150+ ADAD 28 05                                jr z,.clcn323
 151+ ADAF FD 77 00                             ld (iy+0),a
 152+ ADB2 FD 23                                inc iy
 153+ ADB4 10 B0        .clcn323:               djnz .clcn321
 154+ ADB6 3A 43 AD                             ld a,(clcn32z)
 155+ ADB9 C6 30                                add A,'0'
 156+ ADBB FD 77 00                             ld (iy+0),a
 157+ ADBE FD 36 01 00                          ld (iy+1),0
 158+ ADC2 C9                                   ret
 159+ ADC3
# file closed: ./Maths/binary_to_decimal.asm
1039  ADC3                  include "./Maths/ADDHLDESignBC.asm"
# file opened: ./Maths/ADDHLDESignBC.asm
   1+ ADC3              ;; calcs HLB + DEC where B and C are signs
   2+ ADC3              ;; result HL with A as sign
   3+ ADC3              ;; special handling if result is zero forcign sign bit to be zero
   4+ ADC3 78           ADDHLDESignBC:          ld      a,b
   5+ ADC4 E6 80                                and     SignOnly8Bit
   6+ ADC6 A9                                   xor     c                           ;if b sign and c sign were different then bit 7 of a will be 1 which means
   7+ ADC7                                      JumpIfNegative ADDHLDEsBCOppSGN     ;Signs are opposite there fore we can subtract to get difference
   7+ ADC7 FA D5 AD    >                        jp		m, ADDHLDEsBCOppSGN
   8+ ADCA 78           ADDHLDEsBCSameSigns:    ld      a,b
   9+ ADCB B1                                   or      c
  10+ ADCC                                      JumpIfNegative ADDHLDEsBCSameNeg        ; optimisation so we can just do simple add if both positive
  10+ ADCC FA D1 AD    >                        jp		m, ADDHLDEsBCSameNeg
  11+ ADCF 19                                   add     hl,de                       ; both positive so a will already be zero
  12+ ADD0 C9                                   ret
  13+ ADD1 19           ADDHLDEsBCSameNeg:      add     hl,de
  14+ ADD2 78                                   ld      a,b
  15+ ADD3 B1                                   or      c                           ; now set bit for negative value, we won't bother with overflow for now TODO
  16+ ADD4 C9                                   ret
  17+ ADD5 B7           ADDHLDEsBCOppSGN:       or      a
  18+ ADD6 ED 52                                sbc     hl,de
  19+ ADD8 38 02                                jr      c,ADDHLDEsBCOppInvert
  20+ ADDA 78           ADDHLDEsBCOppSGNNoCarry: ld      a,b                                               ; we got here so hl > de therefore we can just take hl's previous sign bit
  21+ ADDB C9                                   ret
  22+ ADDC              ADDHLDEsBCOppInvert:    NegHL                         ; if result was zero then set sign to zero (which doing h or l will give us for free)
  22+ ADDC AF          >                    xor a
  22+ ADDD 95          >                    sub l
  22+ ADDE 6F          >                    ld l,a
  22+ ADDF 9F          >                    sbc a,a
  22+ ADE0 94          >                    sub h
  22+ ADE1 67          >                    ld h,a
  23+ ADE2 78                                   ld      a,b
  24+ ADE3 EE 80                                xor     SignOnly8Bit                ; flip sign bit
  25+ ADE5 C9                                   ret
  26+ ADE6
# file closed: ./Maths/ADDHLDESignBC.asm
1040  ADE6              ;INCLUDE "badd_ll38.asm"
1041  ADE6              ;;INCLUDE "XX12equXX15byXX16.asm"
1042  ADE6                  INCLUDE "./Maths/Utilities/AequAdivQmul96-TIS2.asm"
# file opened: ./Maths/Utilities/AequAdivQmul96-TIS2.asm
   1+ ADE6              AequAdivQmul96ABS:      JumpIfAGTENusng d, .TIS2AccGTEQ			; if A >= Q then return with a 1 (unity i.e. 96) with the correct sign
   1+ ADE6 BA          >                        cp     d
   1+ ADE7 D2 02 AE    >                        jp		nc,.TIS2AccGTEQ
   2+ ADEA 06 FE                                ld			b,$FE						; division roll (replaced varT)
   3+ ADEC CB 27        .TIS2RollTLoop:			sla			a
   4+ ADEE                                      JumpIfALTNusng d,.TIS2SkipSub           ; a < d so don;t subtract
   4+ ADEE BA          >                        cp      d
   4+ ADEF DA 05 AE    >                        jp		c, .TIS2SkipSub
   5+ ADF2 9A                                   sbc			a,d							; do subtraction with carry
   6+ ADF3 37                                   scf
   7+ ADF4 CB 10                                rl			b							; T rolled left to push bit out the end
   8+ ADF6 38 F4                                jr			c,.TIS2RollTLoop				; if we still have not hit the empty marker continue
   9+ ADF8 78           .TIS2SKIPCont:	        ld			a,b							; T
  10+ ADF9 CB 3F                                srl			a							; result / 2
  11+ ADFB CB 3F                                srl			a							; result / 4
  12+ ADFD 47                                   ld			b,a							; t = t /4
  13+ ADFE CB 3F                                srl			a							; result / 8
  14+ AE00 80                                   add			a,b							; result /8 + result /4
  15+ AE01 C9                                   ret
  16+ AE02 3E 60        .TIS2AccGTEQ:           ld			a,$60							; unity
  17+ AE04 C9                                   ret
  18+ AE05 B7           .TIS2SkipSub:           or			a
  19+ AE06 CB 10                                rl			b							; T rolled left to push bit out the end
  20+ AE08 38 E2                                jr			c,.TIS2RollTLoop				; if we still have not hit the empty marker continue
  21+ AE0A C3 F8 AD                             jp			.TIS2SKIPCont
  22+ AE0D
  23+ AE0D
  24+ AE0D              ; USES 			A DE BC
  25+ AE0D              ; DOES NOT USE 	HL
  26+ AE0D              TIS2962C:		; two's compliment entry point, exits not 2's compliment
  27+ AE0D CB 7F        	bit			7,a
  28+ AE0F 28 04        	jr			z,AequAdivQmul96
  29+ AE11 ED 44        	neg										; revers 2s'c and just set neg bit
  30+ AE13 CB FF        	set			7,a
  31+ AE15              ; Note negative numbers are bit 7 set not 2's compliment
  32+ AE15              AequAdivQmul96:								; TIS296:			; .tis2 A = A /Q *96 (or A = A * 3/8 * Q) Reduce Acc in NORM routine i.e. *96/Q clamps at +- 96
  33+ AE15              TIS2:
  34+ AE15 4F           	ld			c,a							; copy of Acc
  35+ AE16 3A BF 97     	ld			a,(varQ)
  36+ AE19 57           	ld			d,a							; d = varQ
  37+ AE1A 79           	ld			a,c							; recover a
  38+ AE1B              AequAdivDmul96:
  39+ AE1B 4F           	ld			c,a							; copy of Acc as we need the sign, alternate entry point assuming D preloaded, wastes an "ld c,a" but simplifies code
  40+ AE1C E6 7F        	and			SignMask8Bit				; ignore sign
  41+ AE1E              	JumpIfAGTENusng d, .TIS2AccGTEQ			; if A >= Q then return with a 1 (unity i.e. 96) with the correct sign
  41+ AE1E BA          >                        cp     d
  41+ AE1F D2 3F AE    >                        jp		nc,.TIS2AccGTEQ
  42+ AE22 06 FE        	ld			b,$FE						; division roll (replaced varT)
  43+ AE24              .TIS2RollTLoop:									; .TIL2	; roll T
  44+ AE24 CB 27        	sla			a
  45+ AE26              	JumpIfALTNusng d,.TIS2SkipSub            ; a < d so don;t subtract
  45+ AE26 BA          >                        cp      d
  45+ AE27 DA 45 AE    >                        jp		c, .TIS2SkipSub
  46+ AE2A 9A           	sbc			a,d							; do subtraction with carry
  47+ AE2B 37           	scf
  48+ AE2C CB 10        	rl			b							; T rolled left to push bit out the end
  49+ AE2E 38 F4        	jr			c,.TIS2RollTLoop				; if we still have not hit the empty marker continue
  50+ AE30              .TIS2SKIPCont:
  51+ AE30 78           	ld			a,b							; T
  52+ AE31 CB 3F        	srl			a							; result / 2
  53+ AE33 CB 3F        	srl			a							; result / 4
  54+ AE35 47           	ld			b,a							; t = t /4
  55+ AE36 CB 3F        	srl			a							; result / 8
  56+ AE38 80           	add			a,b							; result /8 + result /4
  57+ AE39 47           	ld			b,a							; b = 3/8*Acc (max = 96)
  58+ AE3A 79           	ld			a,c							; copy of Acc to look at sign bit
  59+ AE3B E6 80        	and			$80							; recover sign only
  60+ AE3D B0           	or			b							; now put b back in so we have a leading sign bit (note not 2's compliment)
  61+ AE3E C9           	ret
  62+ AE3F              .TIS2AccGTEQ:
  63+ AE3F              ;TI4:										;\ clean to +/- unity
  64+ AE3F 79           	ld			a,c
  65+ AE40 E6 80        	and			$80							; copy of Acc
  66+ AE42 F6 60        	or			$60							; unity
  67+ AE44 C9           	ret
  68+ AE45              .TIS2SkipSub:
  69+ AE45 B7           	or			a
  70+ AE46 CB 10        	rl			b							; T rolled left to push bit out the end
  71+ AE48 38 DA        	jr			c,.TIS2RollTLoop				; if we still have not hit the empty marker continue
  72+ AE4A C3 30 AE     	jp			.TIS2SKIPCont
  73+ AE4D
# file closed: ./Maths/Utilities/AequAdivQmul96-TIS2.asm
1043  AE4D                  INCLUDE "./Maths/Utilities/AequAmulQdiv256-FMLTU.asm"
# file opened: ./Maths/Utilities/AequAmulQdiv256-FMLTU.asm
   1+ AE4D              fmltu:
   2+ AE4D              AequAmulQdiv256:
   3+ AE4D              ; "ASM_FMUTKL .FMLTU	\ -> &2847  \ A=A*Q/256unsg  Fast multiply"
   4+ AE4D 57           	ld	d,a
   5+ AE4E 3A BF 97     	ld	a,(varQ)
   6+ AE51 5F           	ld	e,a
   7+ AE52 ED 30        	mul
   8+ AE54 7A           	ld	a,d				; we get only the high byte which is like doing a /256 if we think of a as low
   9+ AE55 C9           	ret
  10+ AE56
# file closed: ./Maths/Utilities/AequAmulQdiv256-FMLTU.asm
1044  AE56                  INCLUDE "./Maths/Utilities/PRequSpeedDivZZdiv8-DV42-DV42IYH.asm"
# file opened: ./Maths/Utilities/PRequSpeedDivZZdiv8-DV42-DV42IYH.asm
   1+ AE56              ; "DV42,DV42IYH DE = P.R, c = R"
   2+ AE56              DV42IYH:									; as per DV42 but using iyl for Y reg
   3+ AE56 21 AD 9A     		ld		hl,varDustZ
   4+ AE59 FD 7D        		ld		a,iyl
   5+ AE5B ED 31        		add		hl,a
   6+ AE5D 7E           		ld		a,(hl)
   7+ AE5E C3 6A AE     		jp		DV41
   8+ AE61              DV42:										; travel step of dust particle front/rear
   9+ AE61 21 AD 9A     		ld		hl,varDustZ
  10+ AE64 3A 9C 96     		ld		a,(regY)
  11+ AE67 ED 31        		add		hl,a
  12+ AE69 7E           		ld		a,(hl)						; a = SZ[y]
  13+ AE6A              DV41:										; P.R = speed/ (ZZ/8) dust left/right
  14+ AE6A 5F           		ld		e,a							; using E as Q var replacement
  15+ AE6B 3A BB 97     		ld		a,(DELTA)					; DELTA \ speed, how far has dust moved based on its z-coord.
  16+ AE6E              DVID4:										; P-R=A/Qunsg  \P.R = A/Q unsigned called by Hall
  17+ AE6E 06 08        		ld		b,8							; counter
  18+ AE70 CB 27        		sla		a							;
  19+ AE72 57           		ld		d,a							; use d for - p = delta * 2
  20+ AE73 AF           		xor		a
  21+ AE74              DVL4:										; counter x loop (b reg)
  22+ AE74 CB 17        		rl		a							; a = a * 2
  23+ AE76 38 03        		jr		c,DV8						; jump on carry
  24+ AE78 BB           		cp		e							; var Q
  25+ AE79 38 02        		jr		c,DV5						; skip subtraction
  26+ AE7B              DV8:
  27+ AE7B 9B           		sbc		a,e							; a = a - q (with carry)
  28+ AE7C 37           		scf									;  carry gets set
  29+ AE7D              DV5:										; skipped subtraction
  30+ AE7D CB 12        		rl		d							; d (P hi)
  31+ AE7F 10 F3        		djnz	DVL4						; dec b and loop loop X, hi left in P.
  32+ AE81              .CalcRemainder:								; BFRDIV R=A*256/Q
  33+ AE81              ; Note we are not going to call LL28+4 but inline code here:
  34+ AE81 06 FE        		ld		b,$FE						; remainder R for AofQ *256/Q
  35+ AE83 4F           		ld		c,a							; use c as R var
  36+ AE84              .RollRemainder:
  37+ AE84 CB 27        		sla		a
  38+ AE86 38 11        		jr		c,.Reduce					; if a >> generates carry reduce
  39+ AE88 B8           		cp		b							; a < q?
  40+ AE89 30 01        		jr		nc,.DontSBC
  41+ AE8B              .DoSBC:										; a is < q
  42+ AE8B 98           		sbc		a,b							; 	a -= q
  43+ AE8C              .DontSBC:
  44+ AE8C CB 11        		rl		c							; r << 1
  45+ AE8E 38 F4        		jr		c, .RollRemainder			; if rol generated a carry, continue
  46+ AE90 79           		ld		a,c
  47+ AE91 32 C0 97     		ld		(varR),a					; for backwards compat
  48+ AE94 7A           		ld		a,d
  49+ AE95 32 AE 96     		ld		(varP),a
  50+ AE98 C9           		ret									; R (c) left with remainder
  51+ AE99              .Reduce:									; a geneated a carry
  52+ AE99 98           		sbc		a,b							; a = a - (q +1)
  53+ AE9A 37           		scf									; set carry flag for rl
  54+ AE9B CB 11        		rl		c							; r << 1 briging in carry
  55+ AE9D 38 E5        		jr		c,	.RollRemainder			; if a carry fell off bit 7 then repeat
  56+ AE9F 79           		ld		a,c
  57+ AEA0 32 C0 97     		ld		(varR),a					; for backwards compat
  58+ AEA3 7A           		ld		a,d
  59+ AEA4 32 AE 96     		ld		(varP),a
  60+ AEA7 C9           		ret
  61+ AEA8              .AnswerTooBig:
  62+ AEA8 0E FF        		ld		c,$FF						; arse its too big
  63+ AEAA 79           		ld		a,c
  64+ AEAB 32 C0 97     		ld		(varR),a					; for backwards compat
  65+ AEAE 7A           		ld		a,d
  66+ AEAF 32 AE 96     		ld		(varP),a
  67+ AEB2 C9           		ret
  68+ AEB3
# file closed: ./Maths/Utilities/PRequSpeedDivZZdiv8-DV42-DV42IYH.asm
1045  AEB3                  INCLUDE "./Maths/Utilities/AequDmulEdiv256usgn-DEFMUTL.asm"
# file opened: ./Maths/Utilities/AequDmulEdiv256usgn-DEFMUTL.asm
   1+ AEB3
   2+ AEB3              asm_defmutl:
   3+ AEB3              AequDmulEdiv256usgn:
   4+ AEB3              ; "ASM_FMUTKL .FMLTU	\ -> &2847  \ A=D*E/256unsg  Fast multiply"
   5+ AEB3 ED 30        	mul
   6+ AEB5 7A           	ld	a,d				; we get only the high byte which is like doing a /256 if we think of a as low
   7+ AEB6 C9           	ret
   8+ AEB7
   9+ AEB7
# file closed: ./Maths/Utilities/AequDmulEdiv256usgn-DEFMUTL.asm
1046  AEB7              ;INCLUDE "AP2equAPmulQunsgEorP-MLTU2.asm"
1047  AEB7              ;INCLUDE "APequPmulQUnsg-MULTU.asm"
1048  AEB7              ;INCLUDE "APequPmulX-MU11.asm"
1049  AEB7                  INCLUDE "./Maths/Utilities/APequQmulA-MULT1.asm"
# file opened: ./Maths/Utilities/APequQmulA-MULT1.asm
   1+ AEB7              APequQmulA:
   2+ AEB7              asm_mult1:
   3+ AEB7              ; "ASM_MULT1 (DE) A(hi).P(lo) = Q * A first part of MAD, multiply and add. Visited Quite often. A=hi P = lo also returns result in DE"
   4+ AEB7 FE 00        	cp	0
   5+ AEB9 28 1F        	jr	z,.mul0			; quick exit if its Q * 0
   6+ AEBB 5F           	ld	e,a
   7+ AEBC 3A BF 97     	ld	a,(varQ)
   8+ AEBF 57           	ld	d,a
   9+ AEC0 FE 00        	cp	0				; compare a
  10+ AEC2 28 16        	jr	z,.mul0			; quick exit if its 0 * a
  11+ AEC4 AB           	xor	e				; -- = + +- = - -+ = - ++ = +
  12+ AEC5 E6 80        	and $80				; get the resultant sign and save into b
  13+ AEC7 47           	ld	b,a
  14+ AEC8 7A           	ld	a,d
  15+ AEC9 E6 7F        	and	SignMask8Bit	; now strip off sign bits
  16+ AECB 57           	ld	d,a
  17+ AECC 7B           	ld	a,e
  18+ AECD E6 7F        	and SignMask8Bit
  19+ AECF 5F           	ld	e,a
  20+ AED0 ED 30        	mul					; zxn de = d * e
  21+ AED2 7B           	ld	a,e
  22+ AED3 32 AE 96     	ld	(varP),a		; p = lo
  23+ AED6 7A           	ld	a,d				; a = hi
  24+ AED7 B0           	or	b				; de goes to a and varP also re-do sign bit
  25+ AED8 57           	ld	d,a				; we will work with de having result as we may bin vars later
  26+ AED9 C9           	ret
  27+ AEDA              .mul0:
  28+ AEDA AF           	xor	a
  29+ AEDB 32 AE 96     	ld	(varP),a
  30+ AEDE 57           	ld	d,a
  31+ AEDF 5F           	ld  e,a
  32+ AEE0 C9           	ret
  33+ AEE1
# file closed: ./Maths/Utilities/APequQmulA-MULT1.asm
1050  AEE1                  INCLUDE "./Maths/Utilities/badd_ll38.asm"
# file opened: ./Maths/Utilities/badd_ll38.asm
   1+ AEE1              baddll38:				;.LL38	\ -> &4812 \ BADD(S)A=R+Q(SA) \ byte add (subtract)   (Sign S)A = R + Q*(Sign from A^S)
   2+ AEE1              SAEquSRPlusAQ:
   3+ AEE1              ; Calculate the following between sign-magnitude numbers:
   4+ AEE1              ;   (S A) = (S R) + (A Q)
   5+ AEE1              ; where the sign bytes only contain the sign bits, not magnitudes.
   6+ AEE1              ; note goes wrong at <-127 >128 so need 16 bit version
   7+ AEE1              ; so need to fix the issue with carry flag not returning a fault correctly
   8+ AEE1              LL38:
   9+ AEE1              ;	ld		d,a
  10+ AEE1              ;	ld		a,(varQ)
  11+ AEE1              ;	ld		e,a
  12+ AEE1              ;	ld		a,(varS)
  13+ AEE1              ;	ld		h,a
  14+ AEE1              ;	ld		a,(varR)
  15+ AEE1              ;	ld		l,a
  16+ AEE1              ;	call	ADDHLDESignedv3
  17+ AEE1              ;	ld		a,h
  18+ AEE1              ;	ld		(varS),a
  19+ AEE1              ;	ld		a,l
  20+ AEE1              ;	ret
  21+ AEE1              ; calculation table
  22+ AEE1              ;   R     Q    Op            Sign calc
  23+ AEE1              ;	10    5    Add           +    sign same add R sign
  24+ AEE1              ;   -10   5    ABS Sub       -    sign diff ABS R > S sub R sign
  25+ AEE1              ;   10   -5    ABS sub       +    sign diff ABS R > S sub R sign
  26+ AEE1              ;	-10  -5    ABS Add       -    sign same add R sign
  27+ AEE1              ;   5    10    Add           +    sign same add R sign
  28+ AEE1              ;   -5   10    Swap ABS SUB  +    sign diff ABS Q > R swap SUB Q sign
  29+ AEE1              ;   5    -10   swap ABS Sub  -    sign diff ABS Q > R swap SUB R sign
  30+ AEE1              ;   -5   -10   ABS  add      -    sign same add R sign
  31+ AEE1
  32+ AEE1              ;   -10   5    ABS Sub       -    sign diff ABS R > S sub R sign
  33+ AEE1              ;   10   -5    ABS sub       +    sign diff ABS R > S sub R sign
  34+ AEE1              ;   -5   10    Swap ABS SUB  +    sign diff ABS Q > R swap SUB Q sign
  35+ AEE1              ;   5    -10   swap ABS Sub  -    sign diff ABS Q > R swap SUB R sign
  36+ AEE1
  37+ AEE1
  38+ AEE1              ; Calculate sign for Q from A and varS
  39+ AEE1 21 C1 97     	ld		hl,varS							;
  40+ AEE4 AE           	xor		(hl)							;  EOR &83		\ S	\ sign of operator is A xor S
  41+ AEE5 FA F0 AE     	jp		m,.LL39Subtraction  			; if signs are different then we have subtraction
  42+ AEE8 3A BF 97     	ld		a,(varQ)						; Q	\ else addition, S already correct
  43+ AEEB 21 C0 97     	ld		hl,varR
  44+ AEEE 86           	add		a,(hl)							; a = Q + R
  45+ AEEF C9           	ret										; Done carry set if overflow
  46+ AEF0              .LL39Subtraction:							; 1 byte subtraction (S)A = R-Q
  47+ AEF0 3A C0 97     	ld		a,(varR)						; a = R
  48+ AEF3 21 BF 97     	ld		hl,varQ                         ; Q
  49+ AEF6              ;--	JumpIfALTMemHLusng LL39SwapSubtraction	; if a < (hl) then do LL39SwapSubtraction
  50+ AEF6              	ClearCarryFlag                          ; we need to not use carry (6502 is different that it uses the compliement)
  50+ AEF6 B7          >                        or a
  51+ AEF7 9E           	sbc		a,(hl)							; A = R - Q which as R >= Q will always be a positive result
  52+ AEF8 38 01            jr      c,.LL39SignCorrection
  53+ AEFA              ;--    jr      a,.LL39ResultZero
  54+ AEFA              ;--   JumpIfNegative LL39SignCorrection		; if there was underflow we have to correct sign
  55+ AEFA              ;--	or		a								; Clear carry flag to say result is correct
  56+ AEFA C9           	ret
  57+ AEFB              .LL39SignCorrection:
  58+ AEFB FE 00            cp      0                               ; if its 0 then neg will affect flag so we just zero result to save compute
  59+ AEFD 28 0E            jr      z,.LL39ResultZero
  60+ AEFF ED 44            neg                                     ; flip A 2'c value to positive
  61+ AF01 08           	ex		af,af'							; save A temporarily
  62+ AF02 3A C1 97     	ld		a,(varS)						; Flip Sign bit in varS
  63+ AF05 EE 80        	xor		$80							    ;
  64+ AF07 32 C1 97     	ld		(varS),a                        ; flip sign bit of a
  65+ AF0A 08           	ex		af,af'                          ; get back a which is the result
  66+ AF0B                  ClearCarryFlag                          ; clear carry as NEG instrunction sets it for non zero
  66+ AF0B B7          >                        or a
  67+ AF0C C9           	ret
  68+ AF0D              .LL39ResultZero:
  69+ AF0D 32 C1 97         ld      (varS),a                        ; a is zero at this stage so set sign as well
  70+ AF10                  ClearCarryFlag                          ; clear carry
  70+ AF10 B7          >                        or a
  71+ AF11 C9               ret
  72+ AF12              ;--LL39SwapSubtraction:
  73+ AF12              ;--	push	bc
  74+ AF12              ;--	ld		b,a
  75+ AF12              ;--	ld		a,(hl)
  76+ AF12              ;--	sub		b
  77+ AF12              ;--	pop		bc
  78+ AF12              ;--	ex		af,af'							; do we flip here or negate. i think its flip as its overflowed unsigned
  79+ AF12              ;--	ld		a,(varS)
  80+ AF12              ;--	xor		$80
  81+ AF12              ;--	ld		(varS),a
  82+ AF12              ;--	ex		af,af'
  83+ AF12              ;--	ret
  84+ AF12
  85+ AF12              ;;;;	baddll38:				;.LL38	\ -> &4812 \ BADD(S)A=R+Q(SA) \ byte add (subtract)   (Sign S)A = R + Q*(Sign from A^S)
  86+ AF12              ;;;;; Calculate the following between sign-magnitude numbers:
  87+ AF12              ;;;;;   (S A) = (S R) + (A Q)
  88+ AF12              ;;;;; where the sign bytes only contain the sign bits, not magnitudes.
  89+ AF12              ;;;;; note goes wrong at <-127 >128 so need 16 bit version
  90+ AF12              ;;;;LL38:
  91+ AF12              ;;;;; Calculate sign for Q from A and varS
  92+ AF12              ;;;;	ld		hl,varS							;
  93+ AF12              ;;;;	xor		(hl)							;  EOR &83		\ S	\ sign of operator is A xor S
  94+ AF12              ;;;;	jp		m,.LL39Subtraction  			; if signs are different then we have subtraction
  95+ AF12              ;;;;	ld		a,(varQ)						; Q	\ else addition, S already correct
  96+ AF12              ;;;;	ld		hl,varR
  97+ AF12              ;;;;	add		a,(hl)							; a = Q + R
  98+ AF12              ;;;;	ret										; Done
  99+ AF12              ;;;;.LL39Subtraction:							; 1 byte subtraction (S)A = R-Q
 100+ AF12              ;;;;	ld		hl,varQ                         ;
 101+ AF12              ;;;;	ld		a,(hl)
 102+ AF12              ;;;;	JumpIfAGTENusng 128,LL39Sub16bit		; does this need to be 16 bit
 103+ AF12              ;;;;	ld		a,(varR)						;
 104+ AF12              ;;;;	ClearCarryFlag                          ; we need to not use carry (6502 is different that it uses the compliement)
 105+ AF12              ;;;;	sbc		a,(hl)							; A = R - Q
 106+ AF12              ;;;;	jr		c,.SignCorrection				; if there was underflow we have to correct sign
 107+ AF12              ;;;;	or		a								; Clear carry flag to say result is correct
 108+ AF12              ;;;;	ret
 109+ AF12              ;;;;.SignCorrection:
 110+ AF12              ;;;;    neg                                     ; flip A 2'c value to positive
 111+ AF12              ;;;;	ex		af,af'							; save A temporarily
 112+ AF12              ;;;;	ld		a,(varS)						; Flip Sign bit in varS
 113+ AF12              ;;;;	xor		$80							    ;
 114+ AF12              ;;;;	ld		(varS),a                        ; flip sign bit of a
 115+ AF12              ;;;;	ex		af,af'                          ; get back a which is the result
 116+ AF12              ;;;;	ret
 117+ AF12              ;;;;LL39Sub16Bit:
 118+ AF12              ;;;;	ld		e,a
 119+ AF12              ;;;;	ld		d,0
 120+ AF12              ;;;;	ld		a,(varR)
 121+ AF12              ;;;;	ld		l,a
 122+ AF12              ;;;;	ld		h,0
 123+ AF12              ;;;;	ClearCarryFlag
 124+ AF12              ;;;;	sbc		hl,de
 125+ AF12              ;;;;	jr		c,.SignCorrection16bit
 126+ AF12              ;;;;	bit		7,h
 127+ AF12              ;;;;	jr		z,.GoodToReturn
 128+ AF12              ;;;;.Needtonegate:
 129+ AF12              ;;;;	macronegate16hl
 130+ AF12              ;;;;.GoodToReturn
 131+ AF12              ;;;;	ld		a,l
 132+ AF12              ;;;;	or		a
 133+ AF12              ;;;;	ret
 134+ AF12              ;;;;.SignCorrection16bit:
 135+ AF12              ;;;;	macronegate16hl
 136+ AF12              ;;;;	ld		a,(varS)						; Flip Sign bit in varS
 137+ AF12              ;;;;	xor		$80							    ;
 138+ AF12              ;;;;	ld		(varS),a                        ; flip sign bit of a
 139+ AF12              ;;;;	ld		a,l
 140+ AF12              ;;;;	ret

   1+ AF12              ; Note comparing hl vs iY, you need at least 3 incs or decs for hl to be slower
   2+ AF12              ; it may be faster though if we can use hl to avoid memory actions if needed
   3+ AF12              ; need to optimise mad as push hl pop hl and use de doesn't really improve speed
   4+ AF12

   6+ AF12              moveship4Yreg:
   7+ AF12 3A 9C 96     		ld		a,(regY)
   8+ AF15 47           		ld		b,a
   9+ AF16              moveship4breg:
  10+ AF16              		; b = Y index, 9 = nosev, 15 = roofv 21 = sidev
  11+ AF16              MVS4PitchAlphaRollBeta:
  12+ AF16              MVS4:										;.MVS4	\ -> &52A1 \ Moveship4, Y is matrix row, pitch&roll update to coordinates
  13+ AF16 3A CB 96     		ld		a,(ALPHA)					;  ALPHA
  14+ AF19 32 BF 97     		ld		(varQ),a					; player ship's roll Q = Alpha
  15+ AF1C 21 0E C0     		ld		hl,UBnKxsgn
  16+ AF1F 78           		ld		a,b							; from
  17+ AF20 ED 31        		add		hl,a
  18+ AF22 7E           		ld		a,(hl)						; INWK+2,Y
  19+ AF23 32 C0 97     		ld		(varR),a					; R  \ lo
  20+ AF26 23           		inc		hl
  21+ AF27 7E           		ld		a,(hl)						; INWK+3,Y
  22+ AF28 32 C1 97     		ld		(varS),a					; S  \ hi		SR = nosev_y (or axis y)
  23+ AF2B 2B           		dec		hl
  24+ AF2C 2B           		dec		hl
  25+ AF2D 2B           		dec		hl							;
  26+ AF2E 7E           		ld		a,(hl)						; INWK+0,Y
  27+ AF2F 32 AE 96     		ld		(varP),a					; P  \ over-written	 P = nosevx lo
  28+ AF32 23           		inc		hl
  29+ AF33 7E           		ld		a,(hl)						; INWK+1,Y
  30+ AF34 EE 80        		xor		$80							; flip sign  AP = nosevx * - 1
  31+ AF36 CD B7 A7     		call	madXAequQmulAaddRS			; MAD	\ DE = X.A = alpha*INWK+1,Y + INWK+2to3,Y
  32+ AF39 23                   inc     hl
  33+ AF3A 23                   inc     hl
  34+ AF3B 77                   ld      (hl),a                      ; INWK+3,Y \ hi
  35+ AF3C 2B                   dec     hl
  36+ AF3D 3A 9B 96             ld      a,(regX)
  37+ AF40 77                   ld      (hl),a                      ; INWK+2,Y \ Y=Y-aX   \ their comment
  38+ AF41 32 AE 96             ld      (varP),a                    ;  P
  39+ AF44 2B                   dec     hl
  40+ AF45 2B                   dec     hl
  41+ AF46 7E                   ld      a,(hl)                      ; INWK+0,Y
  42+ AF47 32 C0 97             ld      (varR),a                    ;  R	\ lo
  43+ AF4A 23                   inc     hl
  44+ AF4B 7E                   ld      a,(hl)                      ;  INWK+1,Y
  45+ AF4C 32 C1 97             ld      (varS),a                    ; S	\ hi
  46+ AF4F 23                   inc     hl
  47+ AF50 23                   inc     hl
  48+ AF51 7E                   ld      a,(hl)                      ; INWK+3,Y
  49+ AF52 CD B7 A7             call    madXAequQmulAaddRS          ; MAD	\ X.A = alpha*INWK+3,Y + INWK+0to1,Y
  50+ AF55 2B                   dec     hl
  51+ AF56 2B                   dec     hl
  52+ AF57 77                   ld      (hl),a                      ; INWK+1,Y  \ hi
  53+ AF58 3A 9B 96             ld      a,(regX)
  54+ AF5B 2B                   dec     hl
  55+ AF5C 77                   ld      (hl),a                      ; INWK+0,Y  \ X=X+aY   \ their comment
  56+ AF5D 32 AE 96             ld      (varP),a                    ; P
  57+ AF60 3A BA 96             ld      a,(BETA)                    ; BETA
  58+ AF63 32 BF 97             ld      (varQ),a                    ; Q	\ player ship's pitch
  59+ AF66 23                   inc     hl
  60+ AF67 23                   inc     hl
  61+ AF68 7E                   ld      a,(hl)                      ; INWK+2,Y
  62+ AF69 32 C0 97             ld      (varR),a                    ; R	\ lo
  63+ AF6C 23                   inc     hl
  64+ AF6D 7E                   ld      a,(hl)                      ; INWK+3,Y
  65+ AF6E 32 C1 97             ld      (varS),a                    ; S	\ hi
  66+ AF71 23                   inc     hl
  67+ AF72 7E                   ld      a,(hl)                      ; INWK+4,Y
  68+ AF73 32 AE 96             ld      (varP),a                    ; P	\ lo
  69+ AF76 23                   inc     hl
  70+ AF77 7E                   ld      a,(hl)                      ; INWK+5,Y
  71+ AF78 EE 80                xor     $80                         ; flip sign hi
  72+ AF7A CD B7 A7             call    madXAequQmulAaddRS          ; MAD	\ X.A =-beta*INWK+5,Y + INWK+2to3,Y
  73+ AF7D 2B                   dec     hl
  74+ AF7E 2B                   dec     hl
  75+ AF7F 77                   ld      (hl),a                      ; INWK+3,Y \ hi
  76+ AF80 3A 9B 96             ld      a,(regX)
  77+ AF83 2B                   dec     hl
  78+ AF84 77                   ld      (hl),a                      ; INWK+2,Y \ Y=Y-bZ  \ their comment
  79+ AF85 32 AE 96             ld      (varP),a                    ; P
  80+ AF88 23                   inc     hl
  81+ AF89 23                   inc     hl
  82+ AF8A 7E                   ld      a,(hl)                      ; INWK+4,Y
  83+ AF8B 32 C0 97             ld      (varR),a                    ; R	\ lo
  84+ AF8E 23                   inc     hl
  85+ AF8F 7E                   ld      a,(hl)                      ; INWK+5,Y

  87+ AF93 2B                   dec     hl
  88+ AF94 2B                   dec     hl
  89+ AF95 7E                   ld      a,(hl)                      ; INWK+3,Y
  90+ AF96 CD B7 A7             call    madXAequQmulAaddRS          ; MAD	\ X.A = beta*INWK+3,Y + INWK+4,5,Y
  91+ AF99 23                   inc     hl

1056  AFA2                  INCLUDE "./Maths/Utilities/RequAmul256divQ-BFRDIV.asm"
# file opened: ./Maths/Utilities/RequAmul256divQ-BFRDIV.asm
   1+ AFA2              ;;;LL28:
   2+ AFA2              ;;;    ld      c,a                         ;
   3+ AFA2              ;;;    ld      a,(varQ)                    ;
   4+ AFA2              ;;;    ld      b,a                         ;
   5+ AFA2              ;;;    ld      a,c                         ; Get varQ into b and retain c
   6+ AFA2              ;;;RequAmul256divB:                        ;
   7+ AFA2              ;;;LL28Breg:
   8+ AFA2              ;;;; "BFRDIV R = (A * 256 / Q)  byte from remainder of division, not signed a = a, b = q, c = r"
   9+ AFA2              ;;;	cp		b							; Check A >= Q
  10+ AFA2              ;;;	jr		nc, .AnswerTooBig			; A >= Q? yes too big
  11+ AFA2              ;;;.CalcRemainder:
  12+ AFA2              ;;;	ld		c, 	$FE						; set R to $FE
  13+ AFA2              ;;;.RollRemainder:
  14+ AFA2              ;;;	sla		a
  15+ AFA2              ;;;	jr		c,.Reduce					; if a >> generates carry reduce
  16+ AFA2              ;;;	cp		b							; a < q?
  17+ AFA2              ;;;	jr		nc,.DontSBC
  18+ AFA2              ;;;.DoSBC:									; a is < q
  19+ AFA2              ;;;	sbc		a,b							; 	a -= q
  20+ AFA2              ;;;.DontSBC:
  21+ AFA2              ;;;	rl		c							; r << 1
  22+ AFA2              ;;;	jr		c, .RollRemainder			; if rol generated a carry, continue
  23+ AFA2              ;;;    ld      a,c
  24+ AFA2              ;;;    ld      (varR),a
  25+ AFA2              ;;;	ret									; R (c) left with remainder
  26+ AFA2              ;;;.Reduce:								; a geneated a carry
  27+ AFA2              ;;;	sbc		a,b							; a = a - (q +1)
  28+ AFA2              ;;;	scf									; set carry flag for rl
  29+ AFA2              ;;;	rl		c							; r << 1 briging in carry
  30+ AFA2              ;;;	jr		c,	.RollRemainder			; if a carry fell off bit 7 then repeat
  31+ AFA2              ;;;    ld      a,c
  32+ AFA2              ;;;    ld      (varR),a
  33+ AFA2              ;;;	ret
  34+ AFA2              ;;;.AnswerTooBig:
  35+ AFA2              ;;;	ld	    c,$FF							; arse its too big
  36+ AFA2              ;;;    ld      a,c
  37+ AFA2              ;;;    ld      (varR),a
  38+ AFA2              ;;;	ret
  39+ AFA2
  40+ AFA2              BCequAmul256DivC:
  41+ AFA2 59             ld    e,c
  42+ AFA3 67             ld    h,a
  43+ AFA4 2E 00          ld    l,0
  44+ AFA6              AdivEDivide:                             ; this routine performs the operation BC=HL/E
  45+ AFA6 7B             ld a,e                                 ; checking the divisor; returning if it is zero
  46+ AFA7 B7             or a                                   ; from this time on the carry is cleared
  47+ AFA8 C8             ret z
  48+ AFA9 01 FF FF       ld bc,-1                               ; BC is used to accumulate the result
  49+ AFAC 16 00          ld d,0                                 ; clearing D, so DE holds the divisor
  50+ AFAE              AdivEDivLoop:                            ; subtracting DE from HL until the first overflow
  51+ AFAE ED 52          sbc hl,de                              ; since the carry is zero, SBC works as if it was a SUB
  52+ AFB0 03             inc bc                                 ;  note that this instruction does not alter the flags
  53+ AFB1 30 FB          jr nc,AdivEDivLoop                     ; no carry means that there was no overflow
  54+ AFB3 C9             ret
  55+ AFB4
  56+ AFB4              HL_Div_C:
  57+ AFB4              ; Integer divides HL by C
  58+ AFB4              ; Result in HL, remainder in A
  59+ AFB4              ; Clobbers F, B
  60+ AFB4 06 10                ld b,16
  61+ AFB6 AF                   xor a
  62+ AFB7              HL_Div_C_Loop:
  63+ AFB7 29                   add hl,hl
  64+ AFB8 17                   rla
  65+ AFB9 B9                   cp c
  66+ AFBA 38 02                jr c,HL_DivC_Skip
  67+ AFBC 91                   sub c
  68+ AFBD 2C                   inc l
  69+ AFBE              HL_DivC_Skip:
  70+ AFBE 10 F7                djnz HL_Div_C_Loop
  71+ AFC0 7D                   ld   a,l
  72+ AFC1 32 C0 97             ld  (varR),a
  73+ AFC4 C9                   ret
  74+ AFC5
  75+ AFC5
  76+ AFC5
  77+ AFC5              ; Entry point if varQ is populated with demoninator
  78+ AFC5              RequAmul256divQ:
  79+ AFC5              BFRDIV:
  80+ AFC5 F5           		push	af
  81+ AFC6 3A BF 97     		ld		a,(varQ)
  82+ AFC9 4F           		ld		c,a
  83+ AFCA F1           		pop		af
  84+ AFCB FE 00        		cp		0
  85+ AFCD CA E4 AF     		jp		z, HLDIVC_0_BY	; fast exit if numerator is 0
  86+ AFD0              RequAmul256divC:
  87+ AFD0 2E 00        		ld		l,0
  88+ AFD2 67           		ld		h,a
  89+ AFD3              HL_Div_Cold:						; fast entry point if C and HL are already set
  90+ AFD3 06 10        		ld b,16
  91+ AFD5 AF           		xor a
  92+ AFD6              LOOPPOINT:
  93+ AFD6 29           		add hl,hl
  94+ AFD7 17           		rla
  95+ AFD8 B9           		cp c
  96+ AFD9 38 02        		jr c,SKIPINCSUB
  97+ AFDB 2C           		inc l
  98+ AFDC 91           		sub c
  99+ AFDD              SKIPINCSUB:
 100+ AFDD 10 F7        		djnz LOOPPOINT
 101+ AFDF 7D           		ld		a,l
 102+ AFE0 32 C0 97     		ld 		(varR),a
 103+ AFE3 C9           		ret
 104+ AFE4              HLDIVC_0_BY:
 105+ AFE4 32 C0 97     		ld		(varR),a
 106+ AFE7 C9           		ret
 107+ AFE8              ;	push	af
 108+ AFE8              ;	ld		a,b
 109+ AFE8              ;	ld		(varQ),a
 110+ AFE8              ;	pop		af
 111+ AFE8              ;RequAmul256divQ:
 112+ AFE8              ;BFRDIV:									;BFRDIV R=A*256/Q   byte from remainder of division
 113+ AFE8              ;	ld		hl,varQ
 114+ AFE8              ;	JumpIfAGTENusng	(hl),LL2			;  is A >=  Q ?, if yes, answer too big for 1 byte, R=#&FF
 115+ AFE8              ;	ld		b,$FE						; b = X
 116+ AFE8              ;	ld		c,a							; c = R	div roll counter
 117+ AFE8              ;LL31:									; roll R
 118+ AFE8              ;	sla		a
 119+ AFE8              ;	jr		c,LL29						; hop to Reduce
 120+ AFE8              ;	JumpIfALTNusng (hl)					; Q skip sbc if a < Q
 121+ AFE8              ;	sbc		a,(hl)						; a = a - Q
 122+ AFE8              ;	rl		c							; rotate R left
 123+ AFE8              ;	jr		c,LL31						; loop if R poped out a carry bit
 124+ AFE8              ;	jr		LL2Good
 125+ AFE8              ;LL29:									; Reduce
 126+ AFE8              ;	sbc		a,(hl)
 127+ AFE8              ;	scf
 128+ AFE8              ;	rl		c							; roll a carry flag into R
 129+ AFE8              ;	jr		c,LL31						;  loop R
 130+ AFE8              ;	jr		LL2Good
 131+ AFE8              ;LL2:
 132+ AFE8              ;	ld		c,$FF
 133+ AFE8              ;LL2Good:
 134+ AFE8              ;	ld		a,c
 135+ AFE8              ;	ld		(varR),a
 136+ AFE8              ;	ret
 137+ AFE8
# file closed: ./Maths/Utilities/RequAmul256divQ-BFRDIV.asm
1057  AFE8                  INCLUDE "./Maths/Utilities/RequAdivQ-LL61.asm"
# file opened: ./Maths/Utilities/RequAdivQ-LL61.asm
   1+ AFE8              RequAdivQ:
   2+ AFE8              	; R = A/Q, U = remainder, code looked a little odd as if R is reminader and U = result
   3+ AFE8              LL61:										; Handling division R=A/Q for case further down
   4+ AFE8 4F           	ld		c,a								; c = A
   5+ AFE9 3A BF 97     	ld		a,(varQ)						; test for divide by 0
   6+ AFEC FE 00        	cp		0
   7+ AFEE 28 16        	jr		z,LL84							; divide by zero error
   8+ AFF0 57           	ld		d,a								; now we can do C/D
   9+ AFF1 06 08            ld b,8
  10+ AFF3 AF               xor a
  11+ AFF4              LL63:										; roll divide loop
  12+ AFF4 CB 21            sla c
  13+ AFF6 17               rla
  14+ AFF7 BA               cp d
  15+ AFF8 38 02            jr c,LL64
  16+ AFFA 0C               inc c
  17+ AFFB 92               sub d
  18+ AFFC              LL64:
  19+ AFFC 10 F6            djnz LL63
  20+ AFFE 32 BE 97     	ld	(varU),a							; store remainder in U
  21+ B001 79           	ld	a,c
  22+ B002 32 C0 97     	ld	(varR),a							; store remainder in R
  23+ B005 C9               ret
  24+ B006              LL84:										; div error  R=U=#5
  25+ B006 3E 32        	ld		a,50
  26+ B008 32 C0 97     	ld		(varR),a
  27+ B00B 32 BE 97     	ld		(varU),a
  28+ B00E C9           	ret
  29+ B00F
# file closed: ./Maths/Utilities/RequAdivQ-LL61.asm

   1+ B00F              asm_mult12:
   2+ B00F              RSequQmulA:
   3+ B00F              ; "asm_ult12  R.S = Q * A \ visited quite often S = hi, R = lo, odd that its opposite to mult1"
   4+ B00F CD B7 AE     	call APequQmulA
   5+ B012 08           	ex 	af,af'
   6+ B013 7A           	ld	a,d
   7+ B014 32 C1 97     	ld	(varS),a
   8+ B017 7B           	ld	a,e
   9+ B018 32 C0 97     	ld	(varR),a
  10+ B01B 08           	ex 	af,af'
  11+ B01C C9           	ret

   1++B01D              CopyRotMatNoseVtoXX15:

   2++B020 32 79 C0    >                        ld       (XX15VecX),a
   3++B023                      ldCopyByte  UBnkrotmatNosevY+1, XX15VecY

   3++B026 32 7A C0    >                        ld       (XX15VecY),a
   4++B029                      ldCopyByte  UBnkrotmatNosevZ+1 ,XX15VecZ

   9++B039 32 7A C0    >                        ld       (XX15VecY),a
  10++B03C                      ldCopyByte  UBnkrotmatRoofvZ+1 ,XX15VecZ

   1++B056              CopyXX15toRotMatNoseV:
