  43++CCFE                                      ;        pop     af
  44++CCFE              ; XX13 = regX (i.e. iyh)      ( if XX13 = XX13 is 191 if (x2, y2) is off-screen else 0) we bin XX13 as not needed
  45++CCFE              ; so XX13 = 0 if x2_hi = y2_hi = 0, y2_lo is on-screen,  XX13 = 191 if x2_hi or y2_hi are non-zero or y2_lo is off the bottom of the screen
  46++CCFE FD 7C        .LL107                  ld      a,iyh
  47++CD00 32 D8 CC                             ld      (clipXX13),a                ; debug copy iyh to xx13
  48++CD03 7C                                   ld      a,h                         ; If (X1 hi L-OR Y1) hi  goto LL83                   -- X1Y1 off screen and maybe X2Y2
  49++CD04 B0                                   or      b                           ;
  50++CD05 20 27                                jr      nz,.LL83                    ;
  51++CD07 79                                   ld      a,c                         ; or (y1 lo > bottom of screen)
  52++CD08 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; i.e  screen height < y1)
  53++CD0B 20 21                                jr      nz,.LL83
  54++CD0D              ; If we get here, (x1, y1) is on-screen
  55++CD0D FD 7C                                ld      a,iyh                       ; iyh = xx13 at this point if  XX13 <> 0 goto LL108                                                        -- X1Y1 on screen, if we flagged X2Y2 off screen goto LL108
  56++CD0F FE 00                                cp      0
  57++CD11 20 15                                jr      nz, .LL108
  58++CD13              ; Finished clipping exit point ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  59++CD13 79           .ClipDone:              ld      a,c                         ; LL146 (Clip Done)               Y1 = y1 lo, x2 = x2 lo, x1 = x1 lo y1 = y1 lo                                   -- Nothing off screen
  60++CD14 32 7A C0                             ld      (UBnkNewY1),a
  61++CD17 DD 7D                                ld      a,ixl
  62++CD19 32 7C C0                             ld      (UBnkNewY2),a
  63++CD1C 7D                                   ld      a,l
  64++CD1D 32 79 C0                             ld      (UBnkNewX1),a
  65++CD20 7B                                   ld      a,e
  66++CD21 32 7B C0                             ld      (UBnkNewX2),a
  67++CD24                                      ClearCarryFlag                      ; carry is clear so valid to plot is in XX15(0to3)
  67++CD24 B7          >                        or a
  68++CD25 C9                                   ret                                 ; 2nd pro different, it swops based on swop flag around here.
  69++CD26              ; Finished out of bounds exit point -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  70++CD26 37           .PointsOutofBounds:     scf                                 ; LL109 (ClipFailed) carry flag set as not visible
  71++CD27 C9                                   ret
  72++CD28 FD 7C        .LL108:                 ld      a,iyh
  73++CD2A B7                                   or      a
  74++CD2B 1F                                   rra
  75++CD2C FD 67                                ld      iyh,a                       ; (X2Y2 Off Screen)         XX13 = 95 (i.e. divide it by 2)                                                 -- X1Y1 on screen X2Y2 off screen
  76++CD2E                                      ;        push    af                  ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
  77++CD2E                                      ;        ld      a,iyh               ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
  78++CD2E                                      ;        ld      (regX),a            ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
  79++CD2E                                      ;        pop     af                  ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
  80++CD2E FD 7C        .LL83:                  ld      a,iyh                       ; (Line On screen Test)      if XX13 < 128 then only 1 point is on screen so goto LL115                      -- We only need to deal with X2Y2
  81++CD30 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ;
  82++CD33 28 28                                jr      z, .LL115                   ;
  83++CD35 7C                                   ld      a,h                         ; If both x1_hi and x2_hi have bit 7 set, jump to LL109  to return from the subroutine with the C flag set, as the entire line is above the top of the screen
  84++CD36 A2                                   and     d
  85++CD37                                      JumpIfNegative  .PointsOutofBounds
  85++CD37 FA 26 CD    >                        jp		m, .PointsOutofBounds
  86++CD3A 78                                   ld      a,b                         ; If both y1_hi and y2_hi have bit 7 set, jump to LL109  to return from the subroutine with the C flag set, as the entire line is above the top of the screen
  87++CD3B DD A4                                and     ixh
  88++CD3D                                      JumpIfNegative  .PointsOutofBounds
  88++CD3D FA 26 CD    >                        jp		m, .PointsOutofBounds
  89++CD40 7C                                   ld      a,h                         ; If neither (x1_hi - 1) or (x2_hi - 1) have bit 7 set, jump to LL109 to return from the subroutine with the C  flag set, as the line doesn't fit on-screen
  90++CD41 3D                                   dec     a
  91++CD42 FD 6F                                ld      iyl,a                       ; using iyl as XX12+2 var
  92++CD44                                      ;        push    af                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
  93++CD44                                      ;        ld      a,iyl              ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
  94++CD44                                      ;        ld      (varXX12p2),a      ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
  95++CD44                                      ;        pop     af                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
  96++CD44 7A                                   ld      a,d                         ; a = x2 hi
  97++CD45 3D                                   dec     a
  98++CD46 FD B5                                or      iyl                         ; (x2 hi -1 ) or (x1 hi -1)
  99++CD48                                      JumpIfPositive .PointsOutofBounds   ; if both x1 and x2hi were > 0 then subtracting 1 would result in 0..254 so either being negative means it was 0 before
  99++CD48 F2 26 CD    >                        jp		p, .PointsOutofBounds
 100++CD4B              ;by here we have eliminated -ve Y1 bounds so can just test for positive high and bit 7 of lo
 101++CD4B DD 7C                                ld      a,ixh
 102++CD4D 3D                                   dec     a
 103++CD4E FD 6F                                ld      iyl,a
 104++CD50 78                                   ld      a,b
 105++CD51 3D                                   dec     a
 106++CD52 FD B5                                or      iyl
 107++CD54                                      JumpIfPositive .PointsOutofBounds   ; if both x1 and x2hi were > 0 then subtracting 1 would result in 0..254 so either being negative means it was 0 before
 107++CD54 F2 26 CD    >                        jp		p, .PointsOutofBounds
 108++CD57 79                                   ld      a,c
 109++CD58 DD A5                                and     ixl
 110++CD5A                                      JumpIfNegative .PointsOutofBounds   ; really if both are > 127
 110++CD5A FA 26 CD    >                        jp		m, .PointsOutofBounds
 111++CD5D              ; Clip line: calulate the line's gradient
 112++CD5D              ; here as an optimisation we make sure X1 is always < X2  later on
 113++CD5D              .LL115:                 ClearCarryFlag
 113++CD5D B7          >                        or a
 114++CD5E E5 D5        .CalcDX:                push    hl,,de
 115++CD60 EB                                   ex      hl,de                       ; so hl is x2 and de = x1
 116++CD61 ED 52                                sbc     hl,de
 117++CD63                                     ; pop     de                          ; we need de back
 118++CD63 22 CC CC                             ld      (clipDx),hl
 119++CD66 7C                                   ld      a,h
 120++CD67 32 CE CC                             ld      (clipDxHighNonABS),a
 121++CD6A                                     ; ld      a,e                         ;a = x2 lo
 122++CD6A                                     ; sbc     a,l                         ;a= a - x1
 123++CD6A                                     ; ld      (clipDx),a
 124++CD6A                                     ; ld      a,d
 125++CD6A                                     ; sbc     a,h
 126++CD6A                                     ; ld      (clipDxHigh),a                ; later we will just move to sub hl,de
 127++CD6A                                     ; ld      (clipDxHighNonABS),a          ; it looks liek we need this later post scale loop
 128++CD6A              .CalcDy:                ClearCarryFlag
 128++CD6A B7          >                        or a
 129++CD6B DD E5 E1                             ld      hl,ix
 130++CD6E ED 42                                sbc     hl,bc
 131++CD70 54 5D                                ld      de,hl           ;;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21
 132++CD72 22 CF CC                             ld      (clipDy),hl     ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 133++CD75 7C           .CalcQuadrant:          ld      a,h
 134++CD76                                     ; ld      a,ixl
 135++CD76                                     ; sbc     c
 136++CD76                                     ; ld      (clipDy),a
 137++CD76                                     ; ld      a,ixh
 138++CD76                                     ; sbc     a,b
 139++CD76                                     ; ld      (clipDyHigh),a              ; so A = sign of deltay in effect
 140++CD76                                     ; pop     hl
 141++CD76
 142++CD76              ;So we now have delta_x in XX12(3 2), delta_y in XX12(5 4)  where the delta is (x1, y1) - (x2, y2))
 143++CD76                                    ;  push    hl                          ; Set S = the sign of delta_x * the sign of delta_y, so if bit 7 of S is set, the deltas have different signs
 144++CD76 21 CD CC                             ld      hl,clipDxHigh
 145++CD79 AE                                   xor     (hl)                        ; now a = sign dx xor sign dy
 146++CD7A 32 C1 97                             ld      (varS),a                    ; DEBGU putting it in var S too for now
 147++CD7D 32 D2 CC                             ld      (clipDxySign),a
 148++CD80 3A D0 CC     .AbsDy:                 ld      a,(clipDyHigh)
 149++CD83 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 150++CD86 28 0C                                jr      z,.LL110                    ; If delta_y_hi is positive, jump down to LL110 to skip the following
 151++CD88 2A CF CC                             ld      hl,(clipDy)                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 152++CD8B                                      macronegate16de                     ; Otherwise flip the sign of delta_y to make it  positive, starting with the low bytes
 152++CD8B AF          >					xor 	a
 152++CD8C 93          >                    sub 	e
 152++CD8D 5F          >                    ld 		e,a
 152++CD8E 9F          >                    sbc 	a,a
 152++CD8F 92          >                    sub 	d
 152++CD90 57          >                    ld 		d,a
 153++CD91 22 CF CC                             ld      (clipDy),hl                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 154++CD94 2A CC CC     .LL110:                 ld      hl,(clipDx)
 155++CD97 3A CD CC                             ld      a,(clipDxHigh)
 156++CD9A ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; is it a negative X
 157++CD9D 28 06                                jr      z,.LL111                    ; If delta_x_hi is positive, jump down to LL110 to skip the following
 158++CD9F                                      ;ld      hl,(clipDx)                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 159++CD9F                                      macronegate16hl                     ; Otherwise flip the sign of delta_y to make it  positive, starting with the low bytes
 159++CD9F AF          >					xor 	a
 159++CDA0 95          >					sub 	l
 159++CDA1 6F          >					ld 		l,a
 159++CDA2 9F          >					sbc 	a,a
 159++CDA3 94          >					sub 	h
 159++CDA4 67          >					ld 		h,a
 160++CDA5                                     ; ld      (clipDx),hl                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out; we still retain the old sign in NonABS version
 161++CDA5              .LL111:               ;  push    de
 162++CDA5                                     ; ld      hl,(clipDx)                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 163++CDA5                                     ; ld      de,(clipDy)                 ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 164++CDA5 7C           .ScaleLoop:             ld      a,h                         ; At this point DX and DY are ABS values
 165++CDA6 B2                                   or      d
 166++CDA7 28 0A                                jr      z,.CalculateDelta
 166++CDA9
 167++CDA9                                      ShiftDERight1
 167++CDA9 CB 3A       >			   srl d
 167++CDAB CB 1B       >			   rr  e
 168++CDAD                                      ShiftHLRight1
 168++CDAD CB 3C       >			   srl h
 168++CDAF CB 1D       >			   rr  l
 169++CDB1 18 F2                                jr      .ScaleLoop                  ; scaled down Dx and Dy to 8 bit, Dy may have been negative
 170++CDB3              .CalculateDelta:        ;ld      (clipDx),hl                ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 171++CDB3                                      ;ld      (clipDy),de                ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 172++CDB3              ; By now, the high bytes of both |delta_x| and |delta_y| are zero We know that h and d are both = 0 as that's what we tested with a BEQ
 173++CDB3 AF           .LL113:                 xor     a
 174++CDB4 32 DC 97                             ld      (varT),a                    ; t = 0
 175++CDB7 7D                                   ld      a,l                         ; If delta_x_lo < delta_y_lo, so our line is more vertical than horizontal, jump to LL114
 176++CDB8                                      JumpIfALTNusng  e, .LL114           ;
 176++CDB8 BB          >                        cp      e
 176++CDB9 DA C9 CD    >                        jp		c, .LL114
 177++CDBC              ; Here Dx >= Dy sp calculate Delta Y / delta X
 178++CDBC 32 BF 97     .DxGTEDy:               ld      (varQ),a                    ; Set Q = delta_x_lo
 179++CDBF 57                                   ld      d,a                         ; d = also Q for calc
 180++CDC0 7B                                   ld      a,e                         ; Set A = delta_y_lo
 181++CDC1 CD 14 A9                             call    AEquAmul256DivD; LL28Amul256DivD             ; Call LL28 to calculate:  R (actually a reg) = 256 * A / Q   = 256 * delta_y_lo / delta_x_lo
 182++CDC4 32 C0 97                             ld      (varR),a                    ;
 183++CDC7 18 10                                jr      .LL116                      ; Jump to LL116, as we now have the line's gradient in R
 184++CDC9              ; Here Delta Y > Delta X so calulate delta X / delta Y
 185++CDC9 7B           .LL114:                 ld      a,e                         ; Set Q = delta_y_lo
 186++CDCA 57                                   ld      d,a
 187++CDCB 32 BF 97                             ld      (varQ),a
 188++CDCE 7D                                   ld      a,l                         ; Set A = delta_x_lo
 189++CDCF CD 14 A9                             call    AEquAmul256DivD; LL28Amul256DivD             ; Call LL28 to calculate: R = 256 * A / Q  = 256 * delta_x_lo / delta_y_lo
 190++CDD2 32 C0 97                             ld      (varR),a                    ;
 191++CDD5 21 DC 97                             ld      hl,varT                     ; T was set to 0 above, so this sets T = &FF
 192++CDD8 35                                   dec     (hl)
 193++CDD9 D1           .LL116:                 pop     de                          ; get back X2
 194++CDDA E1                                   pop     hl                          ; get back X1 into hl,
 195++CDDB 3A C0 97                             ld      a,(varR)                    ; Store the gradient in XX12+2 this can be optimised later
 196++CDDE 32 D1 CC                             ld      (clipGradient),a
 197++CDE1 FD 6F                                ld      iyl,a
 198++CDE3                                      ;       push    af                   ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 199++CDE3                                      ;       ld      a,iyl                ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 200++CDE3                                      ;       ld      (varXX12p2),a        ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 201++CDE3                                      ;       pop     af                   ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 202++CDE3 3A C1 97                             ld      a,(varS)
 203++CDE6 32 D2 CC                             ld      (clipDxySign),a             ;  Store the type of slope in XX12+3, bit 7 clear means ?Not needed as clipDxySign is used for varS earlier?
 204++CDE9                                                                          ; top left to bottom right, bit 7 set means top right to bottom left **CODE IS WRONG HERE A TEST IS BL to TR
 205++CDE9 FD 7C                                ld      a,iyh                       ; iyh was XX13 from earlier
 206++CDEB FE 00                                cp      0                           ; If XX13 = 0, skip the following instruction
 207++CDED 28 05                                jr      z,.LL138                    ;
 208++CDEF ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; If XX13 is positive, it must be 95. This means (x1, y1) is on-screen but (x2, y2) isn't, so we jump to LLX117 to swap the (x1, y1) and (x2, y2)
 209++CDF2 28 13                                jr      z,.LLX117                   ; coordinates around before doing the actual clipping, because we need to clip (x2, y2) but the clipping routine at LL118 only clips (x1, y1)
 210++CDF4              ; If we get here, XX13 = 0 or 191, so (x1, y1) is off-screen and needs clipping
 211++CDF4 CD 1B CE     .LL138                  call    ClipPointHLBC               ; Call LL118 to move (x1, y1) along the line onto the screen, i.e. clip the line at the (x1, y1) end
 212++CDF7 FD 7C                                ld      a,iyh                       ; If XX13 = 0, i.e. (x2, y2) is on-screen, jump down to LL124 to return with a successfully clipped line
 213++CDF9 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 214++CDFC 28 1A                                jr      z,.LL124
 215++CDFE              ; If we get here, XX13 = 191 (both coordinates are off-screen)
 216++CDFE 7C           .LL117:                 ld      a,h                         ; If either of x1_hi or y1_hi are non-zero, jump to
 217++CDFF B0                                   or      b                           ; LL137 to return from the subroutine with the C flag
 218++CE00 C2 26 CD                             jp      nz, .PointsOutofBounds      ; set, as the line doesn't fit on-screen
 219++CE03 B1                                   or      c                           ; if x1 and y1 hi are both zero test bit 8 or Y1 to see if its > 128
 220++CE04 FA 26 CD                             jp      m, .PointsOutofBounds       ; set, as the line doesn't fit on-screen
 221++CE07              ; If we get here, XX13 = 95 or 191, and in both cases (x2, y2) is off-screen, so we now need to swap the (x1, y1) and (x2, y2) coordinates around before doing
 222++CE07              ; the actual clipping, because we need to clip (x2, y2) but the clipping routine at LL118 only clips (x1, y1)
 223++CE07 EB           .LLX117:                ex      de,hl                       ;  swap X1 and X2
 224++CE08 DD E5                                push    ix                          ;  swap Y1 and Y2
 225++CE0A C5                                   push    bc
 226++CE0B DD E1                                pop     ix
 227++CE0D C1                                   pop     bc
 228++CE0E CD 1B CE                             call    ClipPointHLBC               ;  Call LL118 to move (x1, y1) along the line onto the screen, i.e. clip the line at the (x1, y1) end
 229++CE11 3A D5 CC                             ld      a,(SWAP)
 230++CE14 3D                                   dec     a
 231++CE15 32 D5 CC                             ld      (SWAP),a                    ; Set SWAP = &FF to indicate that we just clipped the line at the (x2, y2) end by swapping the coordinates (the DEC does this as we set SWAP to 0 at the start of this subroutine)
 232++CE18 C3 13 CD     .LL124:                 jp      .ClipDone                    ; now put points in place
 233++CE1B
 234++CE1B              ; Move a point along a line until it is on-screen point is held in HL(X) BC(Y) LL118
 235++CE1B              ; iyh still holds XX13 iyl still holds gradient
 236++CE1B 7C           ClipPointHLBC:          ld      a,h                         ; If x1_hi is positive, jump down to LL119 to skip the following
 237++CE1C ED 27 80                             test    $80
 238++CE1F 28 17                                jr      z,.LL119
 239++CE21 32 C1 97     .X1isNegative:          ld      (varS),a                    ;  Otherwise x1_hi is negative, i.e. off the left of the screen, so set S = x1_hi
 240++CE24 E5 D5 C5                             push    hl,,de,,bc
 241++CE27 CD 9D CE                             call    LL120                       ;  Call LL120 to calculate:   (Y X) = (S x1_lo) * XX12+2      if T = 0   = x1 * gradient
 242++CE2A                                                                          ;                             (Y X) = (S x1_lo) / XX12+2      if T <> 0  = x1 / gradient
 243++CE2A                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 244++CE2A C1 D1 E1                             pop    hl,,de,,bc                   ;  get coordinates back
 245++CE2D 2A D6 CC                             ld      hl,(varYX)
 246++CE30              ;                        ex      hl,de
 247++CE30                                  ;    ld      hl,bc
 248++CE30 09                                   add     hl,bc                       ; y1 = y1 + varYX
 249++CE31 44 4D                                ld      bc,hl
 250++CE33 21 00 00                             ld      hl,0                        ; Set x1 = 0
 251++CE36               ;                       pop     de
 252++CE36 18 1A                                jr      .LL134                      ; in BBC is set x to 0 to force jump, we will just jump
 253++CE38 FE 00        .LL119:                 cp      0
 254++CE3A 28 16                                jr      z,.LL134                    ;  If x1_hi = 0 then jump down to LL134 to skip the following, as the x-coordinate is already on-screen (as 0 <= (x_hi x_lo) <= 255)
 255++CE3C 3D                                   dec     a
 256++CE3D 32 C1 97                             ld      (varS),a                    ;  Otherwise x1_hi is positive, i.e. x1 >= 256 and off the right side of the screen, so set S = x1_hi - 1
 257++CE40 E5 D5 C5                             push    hl,,de,,bc
 258++CE43 CD 9D CE                             call    LL120                      ;  Call LL120 to calculate: (Y X) = (S x1_lo) * XX12+2      if T = 0  = (x1 - 256) * gradient
 259++CE46                                                                          ;                           (Y X) = (S x1_lo) / XX12+2      if T <> 0 = (x1 - 256) / gradient
 260++CE46                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of theline's direction of slope
 261++CE46 C1 D1 E1                             pop     hl,,de,,bc
 262++CE49                                    ;  push    de                          ; Set y1 = y1 + (Y X)
 263++CE49 2A D6 CC                             ld      hl,(varYX)
 264++CE4C                                    ; ex      de,hl                       ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 265++CE4C 09                                   add     hl,bc                        ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 simplfied post debug
 266++CE4D 44 4D                                ld      bc,hl                        ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 simplfied post debug
 267++CE4F                                    ; ex      hl,de                       ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 268++CE4F                                    ; ld      hl,bc                       ;OPTIMISATION 6/11/21 commented out
 269++CE4F                                    ; add     hl,de                       ; y1 = y1 + varYX
 270++CE4F 21 FF 00                             ld      hl,255                      ; Set x1 = 255
 271++CE52                                    ;  pop     de
 272++CE52              ; We have moved the point so the x-coordinate is on screen (i.e. in the range 0-255), so now for they-coordinate
 273++CE52 78           .LL134:                 ld      a,b                         ; If y1_hi is positive, jump down to LL135  to skip the following
 274++CE53 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ;
 275++CE56 28 1A                                jr      z,.LL135                    ;
 276++CE58 32 C1 97                             ld      (varS),a                    ; Otherwise y1_hi is negative, i.e. off the top of the screen, so set S = y1_hi
 277++CE5B 79                                   ld      a,c                         ; Set R = y1_lo
 278++CE5C 32 C0 97                             ld      (varR),a                    ;
 279++CE5F E5 D5 C5                             push    hl,,de,,bc
 280++CE62 CD C4 CE                             call    LL123                       ;  Call LL123 to calculate: (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2      if T = 0  = y1 / gradient
 281++CE65                                                                          ;                           (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2      if T <> 0 = y1 * gradient
 282++CE65                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 283++CE65 C1 D1 E1                             pop     hl,,de,,bc
 284++CE68 D5                                   push    de
 285++CE69 EB                                   ex      hl,de                       ; de = x1
 286++CE6A 2A D6 CC                             ld      hl,(varYX)                  ; hl = varYX
 287++CE6D 19                                   add     hl,de                       ; we don't need to swap back as its an add, Set x1 = x1 + (Y X)
 288++CE6E D1                                   pop     de                          ; de = x2 again
 289++CE6F 01 00 00                             ld      bc,0                        ; Set y1 = 0
 290++CE72 79           .LL135:                 ld      a,c                         ; if bc < 128 then no work to do
 291++CE73 E6 80                                and     $80
 292++CE75 B0                                   or      b                           ; here we see if c bit 8 is set or anything in b as we know if its 0 this would mean there is no need to clip
 293++CE76 C8                                   ret     z
 294++CE77 E5                                   push    hl
 295++CE78 60 69                                ld      hl,bc
 296++CE7A 01 80 00                             ld      bc,128
 297++CE7D B7                                   or      a
 298++CE7E ED 42                                sbc     hl,bc                       ; hl =  (S R) = (y1_hi y1_lo) - 128
 299++CE80 22 C0 97                             ld      (varRS), hl                 ; and now RS (or SR)
 300++CE83 7C                                   ld      a,h
 301++CE84 E1                                   pop     hl
 302++CE85 ED 27 80                             test    $80                         ; If the subtraction underflowed, i.e. if y1 < 192, then y1 is already on-screen, so jump to LL136 to return from the subroutine, as we are done
 303++CE88 C0                                   ret     nz
 304++CE89              ; If we get here then y1 >= 192, i.e. off the bottom of the screen
 305++CE89 E5 D5 C5     .LL139:                 push    hl,,de,,bc
 306++CE8C CD C4 CE                             call    LL123                       ;  Call LL123 to calculate: (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2      if T = 0  = y1 / gradient
 307++CE8F                                                                          ;                           (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2      if T <> 0 = y1 * gradient
 308++CE8F                                                                          ;  with the sign of (Y X) set to the opposite of the line's direction of slope
 309++CE8F C1 D1 E1                             pop     hl,,de,,bc
 310++CE92 D5                                   push    de
 311++CE93 EB                                   ex      hl,de
 312++CE94 2A D6 CC                             ld      hl,(varYX)
 313++CE97 19                                   add     hl,de                       ; we don't need to swap back as its an add, Set x1 = x1 + (Y X)
 314++CE98 01 7F 00                             ld      bc,127                      ; set bc to 127 bottom of screen
 315++CE9B D1                                   pop     de
 316++CE9C C9           .LL136:                 ret                                 ;  Return from the subroutine
 317++CE9D
 318++CE9D
 319++CE9D              ; Calculate the following:   * If T = 0  (more vertical than horizontal), (Y X) = (S x1_lo) * XX12+2
 320++CE9D              ;                            * If T <> 0 (more horizontal than vertical), (Y X) = (S x1_lo) / XX12+2
 321++CE9D              ;                              giving (Y X) the opposite sign to the slope direction in XX12+3.
 322++CE9D              ; Other entry points        LL122                Calculate (Y X) = (S R) * Q and set the sign to the opposite of the top byte on the stack
 323++CE9D 7D           LL120:                  ld      a,l                          ; Set R = x1_lo
 324++CE9E 32 C0 97                             ld      (varR),a
 325++CEA1 CD 0C CF                             call    LL129                        ;  Call LL129 to do the following:  Q = XX12+2   = line gradient  A = S EOR XX12+3 = S EOR slope direction (S R) = |S R| So A contains the sign of S * slope direction
 326++CEA4 F5                                   push    af                           ;  Store A on the stack so we can use it later
 327++CEA5 C5                                   push    bc
 328++CEA6 47                                   ld      b,a
 329++CEA7 3A DC 97                             ld      a,(varT)                     ; instead : (Y X) = (S R ) / Q
 330++CEAA FE 00                                cp      0
 331++CEAC 78                                   ld      a,b
 332++CEAD C1                                   pop     bc                           ; we can't use af as that would disrupt the flags
 333++CEAE 20 23                                jr      nz, LL121
 334++CEB0              ; The following calculates:  (Y X) = (S R) * Q using the same shift-and-add algorithm that's documented in MULT1
 335++CEB0 3A D1 CC     LL122:                  ld      a,(clipGradient)
 336++CEB3 32 BF 97                             ld      (varQ),a; optimise
 337++CEB6 CD 92 A7                             call    HLequSRmulQdiv256
 338++CEB9 22 D6 CC                             ld      (varYX),hl
 339++CEBC F1                                   pop     af
 340++CEBD ED 27 80                             test    $80
 341++CEC0 CA FF CE                             jp      z,LL133
 342++CEC3 C9                                   ret
 343++CEC4              ; Calculate the following: * If T = 0,  calculate (Y X) = (S R) / XX12+2 (actually SR & XX12+2 /256)
 344++CEC4              ;                          * If T <> 0, calculate (Y X) = (S R) * XX12+2
 345++CEC4              ;                          giving (Y X) the opposite sign to the slope direction in XX12+3.
 346++CEC4              ;
 347++CEC4              ; Other entry points:      LL121                Calculate (Y X) = (S R) / Q and set the sign to the opposite of the top byte on the stack
 348++CEC4              ;                          LL133                Negate (Y X) and return from the subroutine
 349++CEC4              ;                          LL128                Contains an RTS
 350++CEC4 CD 0C CF     LL123:                  call    LL129                       ; Call LL129 to do the following: Q = XX12+2   = line gradient  A = S EOR XX12+3 = S EOR slope direction (S R) = |S R| So A contains the sign of S * slope direction
 351++CEC7 F5                                   push    af                          ; Store A on the stack so we can use it later
 352++CEC8 C5                                   push    bc                          ; If T is non-zero, so it's more horizontal than vertical, jump down to LL121 to calculate this
 353++CEC9 47                                   ld      b,a
 354++CECA 3A DC 97                             ld      a,(varT)                    ; instead : (Y X) = (S R) * Q *** this looks to be the wrong way roudn for Y!!!!
 355++CECD FE 00                                cp      0
 356++CECF 78                                   ld      a,b
 357++CED0 C1                                   pop     bc
 358++CED1 20 DD                                jr      nz, LL122
 359++CED3              ; The following calculates: (Y X) = (S R) / Q using the same shift-and-subtract algorithm that's documented in TIS2, its actually X.Y=R.S*256/Q
 360++CED3 11 FE FF     LL121:                  ld      de,$FFFE                    ; set XY to &FFFE at start, de holds XY
 361++CED6 2A C0 97                             ld      hl,(varRS)                  ; hl = RS
 362++CED9 3A BF 97                             ld      a,(varQ)
 363++CEDC 47                                   ld      b,a                         ; b = q
 364++CEDD              .LL130:                 ShiftHLLeft1                        ; RS *= 2
 364++CEDD CB 25       >			   sla l
 364++CEDF CB 14       >			   rl  h
 365++CEE1 7C                                   ld      a,h
 366++CEE2 38 04                                jr      c,.LL131                    ; if S overflowed skip Q test and do subtractions
 367++CEE4                                      JumpIfALTNusng b, .LL132            ; if S <  Q = 256/gradient skip subtractions
 367++CEE4 B8          >                        cp      b
 367++CEE5 DA F0 CE    >                        jp		c, .LL132
 368++CEE8 3F           .LL131:                 ccf                                 ; compliment carry
 369++CEE9 98                                   sbc     a,b                         ; q
 370++CEEA 67                                   ld      h,a                         ; h (s)
 371++CEEB 7D                                   ld      a,l                         ; r
 372++CEEC DE 00                                sbc     a,0                         ; 0 - so in effect SR - Q*256
 373++CEEE 37                                   scf                                 ; set carry for next rolls
 374++CEEF 3F                                   ccf
 375++CEF0              .LL132:                 RollDELeft1                         ; Rotate de bits left
 375++CEF0 CB 13       >               rl  e
 375++CEF2 CB 12       >               rl  d
 376++CEF4 38 E7                                jr      c,.LL130                    ;
 377++CEF6 ED 53 D6 CC                          ld      (varYX),de
 378++CEFA F1                                   pop     af              ; get back sign
 379++CEFB ED 27 80                             test    $80
 380++CEFE C8                                   ret     z               ; if negative then return with value as is reversed sign
 381++CEFF 2A D6 CC     LL133:                  ld      hl,(varYX)      ; may not actually need this?
 382++CF02                                      NegHL
 382++CF02 AF          >                    xor a
 382++CF03 95          >                    sub l
 382++CF04 6F          >                    ld l,a
 382++CF05 9F          >                    sbc a,a
 382++CF06 94          >                    sub h
 382++CF07 67          >                    ld h,a
 383++CF08 22 D6 CC                             ld      (varYX),hl
 384++CF0B C9           LL128:                  ret
 385++CF0C              ; Do the following, in this order:  Q = XX12+2
 386++CF0C              ;                                   A = S EOR XX12+3
 387++CF0C              ;                                   (S R) = |S R|
 388++CF0C              ; This sets up the variables required above to calculate (S R) / XX12+2 and give the result the opposite sign to XX13+3.
 389++CF0C 3A D1 CC     LL129:                  ld      a,(clipGradient)
 390++CF0F 32 BF 97                             ld      (varQ),a                    ;Set Q = XX12+2
 391++CF12 3A C1 97                             ld      a,(varS)                    ; If S is positive, jump to LL127
 392++CF15 E5 F5                                push    hl,,af
 393++CF17 ED 27 80                             test    $80
 394++CF1A 28 0C                                jr      z,.LL127
 395++CF1C 2A C0 97                             ld      hl,(varRS)                  ; else SR = | SR|
 396++CF1F                                      NegHL
 396++CF1F AF          >                    xor a
 396++CF20 95          >                    sub l
 396++CF21 6F          >                    ld l,a
 396++CF22 9F          >                    sbc a,a
 396++CF23 94          >                    sub h
 396++CF24 67          >                    ld h,a
 397++CF25 22 C0 97                             ld      (varRS),hl
 398++CF28 21 D2 CC     .LL127:                 ld      hl,clipDxySign
 399++CF2B F1                                   pop     af
 400++CF2C AE                                   xor     (hl)                        ; a = S XOR clipDxySign
 401++CF2D E1                                   pop     hl
 402++CF2E C9                                   ret
 403++CF2F
# file closed: ././ModelRender/CLIP-LL145.asm
 536+ CF2F              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 537+ CF2F                                      include "./Universe/Ships/CopyRotmatToTransMat.asm"
# file opened: ././Universe/Ships/CopyRotmatToTransMat.asm
   1++CF2F              ; Set TransMatTo
   2++CF2F              ; XX16(1 0)   (3 2)   (5 4)   = sidev_x sidev_y sidev_z XX16(13,12) (15 14) (17 16)
   3++CF2F              ; XX16(7 6)   (9 8)   (11 10) = roofv_x roofv_y roofv_z XX16(7 6)   (9 8)   (11 10)
   4++CF2F              ; XX16(13 12) (15 14) (17 16) = nosev_x nosev_y nosev_z XX16(1 0)   (3 2)   (5 4)
   5++CF2F              ; This moves Side XYZ to position 0, Roof XYZ to position 1 annd nose XYZ to position 2 as a copy of each batch of 6 bytes
   6++CF2F              CopyRotmatToTransMat:                       ; Tested
   7++CF2F 21 15 C0     LL15_CopyRotMat:        ld      hl,UBnkrotmatSidevX
   8++CF32
   9++CF32 11 34 C0                             ld      de,UBnkTransmatSidevX
  10++CF35                                      SixLDIInstrunctions
  10++CF35 ED A0       >                        ldi
  10++CF37 ED A0       >                        ldi
  10++CF39 ED A0       >                        ldi
  10++CF3B ED A0       >                        ldi
  10++CF3D ED A0       >                        ldi
  10++CF3F ED A0       >                        ldi
  11++CF41 21 1B C0                             ld      hl,UBnkrotmatRoofvX
  12++CF44 11 3A C0                             ld      de, UBnkTransmatRoofvX
  13++CF47                                      SixLDIInstrunctions

  13++CF49 ED A0       >                        ldi
  13++CF4B ED A0       >                        ldi
  13++CF4D ED A0       >                        ldi
  13++CF4F ED A0       >                        ldi

  14++CF53 21 21 C0                             ld      hl,UBnkrotmatNosevX

  17++CF65 C9                                   ret

 538+ CF66                                      include "./Universe/Ships/TransposeXX12ByShipToXX15.asm"
# file opened: ././Universe/Ships/TransposeXX12ByShipToXX15.asm
   1++CF66              TransposeXX12ByShipToXX15:
   2++CF66 2A 7F C0             ld		hl,(UBnkXX12xLo)					; get X into HL
   3++CF69 7C           		ld		a,h			                        ; get XX12 Sign
   4++CF6A E6 80        		and		$80									; check sign bit on high byte
   5++CF6C 47           		ld		b,a									; and put it in of 12xlo in b
   6++CF6D                      ;110921 debugld      h,0
   7++CF6D 7C                   ld      a,h
   8++CF6E E6 7F                and     $7F
   9++CF70 67                   ld      h,a
  10++CF71                      ;110921 debugld      h,0
  11++CF71 ED 5B 0C C0  		ld		de,(UBnKxlo)						;
  12++CF75 3A 0E C0     		ld		a,(UBnKxsgn)						; get Ship Pos (low,high,sign)
  13++CF78 E6 80        		and		$80									; make sure we only have bit 7
  14++CF7A 4F           		ld		c,a									; and put sign of unkxsgn c
  15++CF7B CD C3 AD     		call 	ADDHLDESignBC; XX12ProcessCalcHLPlusDESignBC		; this will result in HL = result and A = sign
  16++CF7E B4           		or		h									; combine sign in A with H to give 15 bit signed (*NOT* 2's c)
  17++CF7F 67           		ld		h,a
  18++CF80 22 79 C0     		ld		(UBnkXScaled),hl					; now write it out to XX15 X pos
  19++CF83              ; ..................................
  20++CF83 2A 81 C0     		ld		hl,(UBnkXX12yLo)					; Repeat above for Y coordinate
  21++CF86 7C           		ld		a,h
  22++CF87 E6 80        		and		$80
  23++CF89 47           		ld		b,a
  24++CF8A                      ;110921 debugld      h,0
  25++CF8A 7C                   ld      a,h
  26++CF8B E6 7F                and     $7F
  27++CF8D 67                   ld      h,a
  28++CF8E                      ;110921 debugld      h,0
  29++CF8E ED 5B 0F C0  		ld		de,(UBnKylo)
  30++CF92 3A 11 C0     		ld		a,(UBnKysgn)
  31++CF95 E6 80        		and		$80									; make sure we only have bit 7
  32++CF97 4F           		ld		c,a
  33++CF98 CD C3 AD     		call 	ADDHLDESignBC; XX12ProcessCalcHLPlusDESignBC
  34++CF9B B4           		or		h									; combine sign in A with H
  35++CF9C 67           		ld		h,a
  36++CF9D 22 7B C0     		ld		(UBnkYScaled),hl
  37++CFA0              ; ..................................
  38++CFA0 2A 83 C0     		ld		hl,(UBnkXX12zLo)					; and now repeat for Z cooord
  39++CFA3 7C           		ld		a,h
  40++CFA4 E6 80        		and		$80
  41++CFA6 47           		ld		b,a
  42++CFA7                      ;110921 debugld      h,0
  43++CFA7 7C                   ld      a,h
  44++CFA8 E6 7F                and     $7F
  45++CFAA 67                   ld      h,a
  46++CFAB                      ;110921 debugld      h,0
  47++CFAB ED 5B 12 C0  		ld		de,(UBnKzlo)
  48++CFAF 3A 14 C0     		ld		a,(UBnKzsgn)
  49++CFB2 E6 80        		and		$80									; make sure we only have bit 7
  50++CFB4 4F           		ld		c,a
  51++CFB5 CD C3 AD     		call 	ADDHLDESignBC; XX12ProcessCalcHLPlusDESignBC
  52++CFB8 B4           		or		h									; combine sign in A with H
  53++CFB9 67           		ld		h,a
  54++CFBA CB 7C        		bit		7,h                                 ; if sign if positive then we don't need to do the clamp so we ony jump
  55++CFBC 20 16        		jr		nz,ClampZto4                        ; result was negative so we need to clamp to 4
  56++CFBE E6 7F                and     $7F                                 ; a = value unsigned
  57++CFC0 20 06                jr      nz,NoClampZto4                      ; if high byte was 0 then we could need to clamp still by this stage its +v but and will set z flag if high byte is zero
  58++CFC2 7D                   ld      a,l                                 ; get low byte now
  59++CFC3              		JumpIfALTNusng 4,ClampZto4					; if its < 4 then fix at 4
  59++CFC3 FE 04       >                        cp      4
  59++CFC5 DA D4 CF    >                        jp		c, ClampZto4
  60++CFC8              NoClampZto4:
  61++CFC8 22 7D C0     		ld		(UBnkZScaled),hl					; hl = signed calculation and > 4
  62++CFCB 7D           		ld		a,l									; in addition write out the z cooord to UT for now for backwards compat (DEBUG TODO remove later)
  63++CFCC 32 DC 97             ld      (varT),a
  64++CFCF 7C           		ld		a,h
  65++CFD0 32 BE 97             ld      (varU),a
  66++CFD3 C9           		ret
  67++CFD4              ClampZto4:											; This is where we limit 4 to a minimum of 4
  68++CFD4 21 04 00     		ld		hl,4
  69++CFD7 22 7D C0     		ld		(UBnkZScaled),hl; BODGE FOR NOW
  70++CFDA 7D           		ld		a,l
  71++CFDB 32 DC 97             ld      (varT),a                            ;                                                                           ;;;
  72++CFDE 7C           		ld		a,h
  73++CFDF 32 BE 97             ld      (varU),a 						; compatibility for now
  74++CFE2 C9           		ret
  75++CFE3
# file closed: ././Universe/Ships/TransposeXX12ByShipToXX15.asm
 539+ CFE3                                      include "./Maths/Utilities/ScaleNodeTo8Bit.asm"
# file opened: ././Maths/Utilities/ScaleNodeTo8Bit.asm
   1++CFE3              ScaleNodeTo8Bit:								; TODO make signed
   2++CFE3 ED 4B 7D C0  	ld			bc,(UBnkZScaled)
   3++CFE7 2A 79 C0     	ld			hl,(UBnkXScaled)
   4++CFEA ED 5B 7B C0  	ld			de,(UBnkYScaled)
   5++CFEE              SetABSbc:
   6++CFEE 78           	ld			a,b
   7++CFEF DD 67        	ld			ixh,a
   8++CFF1 E6 7F        	and			SignMask8Bit
   9++CFF3 47           	ld			b,a									; bc = ABS bc
  10++CFF4              SetABShl:
  11++CFF4 7C           	ld			a,h
  12++CFF5 DD 6F        	ld			ixl,a
  13++CFF7 E6 7F        	and			SignMask8Bit
  14++CFF9 67           	ld			h,a									; hl = ABS hl
  15++CFFA              SetABSde:
  16++CFFA 7A           	ld			a,d
  17++CFFB FD 67        	ld			iyh,a
  18++CFFD E6 7F        	and			SignMask8Bit
  19++CFFF 57           	ld			d,a									; de = ABS de
  20++D000              ScaleNodeTo8BitLoop:
  21++D000 78               ld          a,b		                            ; U	\ z hi
  22++D001 B4           	or			h                                   ; XX15+1	\ x hi
  23++D002 B2           	or			d                                   ; XX15+4	\ y hi
  24++D003 28 0F            jr          z,ScaleNodeDone                   ; if X, Y, Z = 0  exit loop down once hi U rolled to 0
  25++D005                  ShiftHLRight1
  25++D005 CB 3C       >			   srl h
  25++D007 CB 1D       >			   rr  l
  26++D009                  ShiftDERight1
  26++D009 CB 3A       >			   srl d
  26++D00B CB 1B       >			   rr  e
  27++D00D              	ShiftBCRight1
  27++D00D CB 38       >			   srl b
  27++D00F CB 19       >			   rr  c
  28++D011 C3 00 D0         jp          ScaleNodeTo8BitLoop
  29++D014              ScaleNodeDone:										; now we have scaled values we have to deal with sign
  30++D014 DD 7C        	ld			a,ixh								; get sign bit and or with b
  31++D016 E6 80        	and			SignOnly8Bit
  32++D018 B0           	or			b
  33++D019 47           	ld			b,a
  34++D01A              SignforHL:
  35++D01A DD 7D        	ld			a,ixl								; get sign bit and or with b
  36++D01C E6 80        	and			SignOnly8Bit
  37++D01E B4           	or			h
  38++D01F 67           	ld			h,a
  39++D020              SignforDE:
  40++D020 FD 7C        	ld			a,iyh								; get sign bit and or with b
  41++D022 E6 80        	and			SignOnly8Bit
  42++D024 B2           	or			d
  43++D025 57           	ld			d,a
  44++D026              SignsDoneSaveResult:
  45++D026 ED 43 7D C0  	ld			(UBnkZScaled),bc
  46++D02A 22 79 C0     	ld			(UBnkXScaled),hl
  47++D02D ED 53 7B C0  	ld			(UBnkYScaled),de
  48++D031 78           	ld			a,b
  49++D032 32 BE 97     	ld			(varU),a
  50++D035 79           	ld			a,c
  51++D036 32 DC 97     	ld			(varT),a
  52++D039 C9           	ret
  53++D03A
# file closed: ././Maths/Utilities/ScaleNodeTo8Bit.asm

 542+ D03A 21 A6 C0     SetFaceAVisible:        ld      hl,UbnkFaceVisArray
 543+ D03D ED 31                                add     hl,a
 544+ D03F 3E FF                                ld      a,$FF
 545+ D041 77                                   ld      (hl),a
 546+ D042 C9                                   ret
 547+ D043              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 548+ D043 21 A6 C0     SetFaceAHidden:         ld      hl,UbnkFaceVisArray
 549+ D046 ED 31                                add     hl,a
 550+ D048 AF                                   xor     a
 551+ D049 77                                   ld      (hl),a
 552+ D04A C9                                   ret
 553+ D04B              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 554+ D04B 3A 10 C3     SetAllFacesVisible:     ld      a,(FaceCtX4Addr)            ; (XX0),Y which is XX0[0C] or UBnkHullCopy+FaceCtX4Addr                                 ;;; Faces count (previously loaded into b up front but no need to shave bytes for clarity
 555+ D04E CB 3F                                srl     a                           ; else do explosion needs all vertices                                                  ;;;
 556+ D050 CB 3F                                srl     a                           ;  /=4  TODO add this into blueprint data for speed                                                           ;;; For loop = 15 to 0
 557+ D052 47                                   ld      b,a                         ; b = Xreg = number of normals, faces
 558+ D053 21 A6 C0                             ld      hl,UbnkFaceVisArray
 559+ D056 3E FF                                ld      a,$FF
 560+ D058              SetAllFacesVisibleLoop:
 561+ D058 77           EE30:                   ld      (hl),a
 562+ D059 23                                   inc     hl
 563+ D05A 10 FC                                djnz    SetAllFacesVisibleLoop
 564+ D05C C9                                   ret
 565+ D05D              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 566+ D05D 3A 10 C3     SetAllFacesHidden:      ld      a,(FaceCtX4Addr)            ; (XX0),Y which is XX0[0C] or UBnkHullCopy+ShipHullFacesCount                           ;;; Faces count (previously loaded into b up front but no need to shave bytes for clarity
 567+ D060 CB 3F                                srl     a                           ; else do explosion needs all vertices                                                  ;;;
 568+ D062 CB 3F                                srl     a                           ;  /=4                                                                                  ;;; For loop = 15 to 0
 569+ D064 47                                   ld      b,a                         ; b = Xreg = number of normals, faces
 570+ D065 06 10                                ld      b,16
 571+ D067 21 A6 C0                             ld      hl,UbnkFaceVisArray
 572+ D06A 3E 00                                ld      a,$00
 573+ D06C 77           SetAllFacesHiddenLoop:  ld      (hl),a
 574+ D06D 23                                   inc     hl
 575+ D06E 10 FC                                djnz    SetAllFacesHiddenLoop
 576+ D070 C9                                   ret

 578+ D071              ;;;;X = normal scale
 579+ D071              ;;;;ZtempHi = zhi
 580+ D071              ;;;;......................................................
 581+ D071              ;;;; if ztemp hi <> 0                                   ::Scale Object Distance
 582+ D071              ;;;;  Loop                                              ::LL90
 583+ D071              ;;;;     inc X
 584+ D071              ;;;;     divide X, Y & ZtempHiLo by 2
 585+ D071              ;;;;  Until ZtempHi = 0
 586+ D071              ;;;;......................................................
 587+ D071              ;-LL21---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 588+ D071                                      include "Universe/Ships/NormaliseTransMat.asm"
# file opened: ./Universe/Ships/NormaliseTransMat.asm
   1++D071              ;divdide by 16 using undocumented instrunctions
   2++D071              Norm256mulAdivQ:
   3++D071 47               ld      b,a
   4++D072 0E 00            ld      c,0
   5++D074 16 00            ld      d,0
   6++D076 3A BF 97         ld      a,(varQ)
   7++D079 5F               ld      e,a
   8++D07A              ;Input: BC = Dividend, DE = Divisor, HL = 0
   9++D07A              ;Output: BC = Quotient, HL = Remainder
  10++D07A              NormDIV16UNDOC:
  11++D07A 21 00 00         ld      hl,0
  12++D07D 78               ld      a,b
  13++D07E 06 10            ld      b,16
  14++D080              NormDIV16UNDOCLOOP:
  15++D080 CB 31        	sll	    c		; unroll 16 times
  16++D082 17           	rla	    		; ...
  17++D083 ED 6A        	adc	    hl,hl		; ...
  18++D085 ED 52        	sbc	    hl,de		; ...
  19++D087 30 02        	jr	    nc,NormDIV16UNDOCSKIP		; ...
  20++D089 19           	add	    hl,de		; ...
  21++D08A 0D           	dec	    c		; ...
  22++D08B              NormDIV16UNDOCSKIP:
  23++D08B 10 F3            djnz    NormDIV16UNDOCLOOP
  24++D08D 79               ld      a,c
  25++D08E 32 C0 97         ld      (varR),a
  26++D091 C9               ret
  27++D092
  28++D092              ; Tested OK
  29++D092              NormaliseTransMat:
  30++D092              ;LL21
  31++D092 21 45 C0             ld      hl,UBnkTransmatNosevZ+1         ; initialise loop
  32++D095 0E C5                ld      c,ConstNorm                 ; c = Q = norm = 197
  33++D097 79                   ld      a,c
  34++D098 32 BF 97             ld      (varQ),a                    ; set up varQ
  35++D09B 06 09                ld      b,9                         ; total of 9 elements to transform
  36++D09D              LL21Loop:
  37++D09D 56                   ld      d,(hl)
  38++D09E 2B                   dec     hl
  39++D09F 5E                   ld      e,(hl)                      ; de = hilo now   hl now = pointer to low byte
  40++D0A0                      ShiftDELeft1                        ; De = DE * 2
  40++D0A0 CB 23       >			   sla e
  40++D0A2 CB 12       >			   rl  d
  41++D0A4 7A                   ld      a,d                         ; a = hi byte after shifting
  42++D0A5 E5           		push	hl
  43++D0A6 C5           		push	bc
  44++D0A7 CD 71 D0             call    Norm256mulAdivQ
  45++D0AA              		;===call    RequAmul256divC				; R = (2(hi).0)/ConstNorm - LL28 Optimised BFRDIV R=A*256/Q = delta_y / delta_x Use Y/X grad. as not steep
  46++D0AA 79                   ld      a,c                         ; BFRDIV returns R also in l reg
  47++D0AB C1           		pop		bc
  48++D0AC E1           		pop		hl							; bc gets wrecked by BFRDIV
  49++D0AD 77                   ld      (hl),a                      ; write low result to low byte so zlo = (zhl *2)/197, we keep hi byte in tact as we need the sign bit
  50++D0AE 2B                   dec     hl                          ; now hl = hi byte of pre val e.g z->y->x
  51++D0AF 10 EC                djnz    LL21Loop                    ; loop from 2zLo through to 0xLo
  52++D0B1 C9                   ret
  53++D0B2
# file closed: ./Universe/Ships/NormaliseTransMat.asm
 589+ D0B2              ;-LL91---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 590+ D0B2
 591+ D0B2              ; Now we have
 592+ D0B2              ;   * XX18(2 1 0) = (x_sign x_hi x_lo)
 593+ D0B2              ;   * XX18(5 4 3) = (y_sign y_hi y_lo)
 594+ D0B2              ;   * XX18(8 7 6) = (z_sign z_hi z_lo)
 595+ D0B2              ;
 596+ D0B2              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 597+ D0B2                                      include "Universe/Ships/InverseXX16.asm"
# file opened: ./Universe/Ships/InverseXX16.asm
   1++D0B2              ; TESTEDOK
   2++D0B2
   3++D0B2              ;ScaleOrientationXX16:                       ; DEBUG TODO will combine with inverse later
   4++D0B2              ;        ld      a,(XX17)
   5++D0B2              ;        ld      ixl,a
   6++D0B2              ;        ld      ixh,9
   7++D0B2              ;        ld      hl,UBnkTransInv0x
   8++D0B2              ;        ld      a,(hl)
   9++D0B2              ;ScaleNode:
  10++D0B2              ;        ld      b,ixl
  11++D0B2              ;ScaleNodeLoop:
  12++D0B2              ;        sla      a
  13++D0B2              ;        djnz    ScaleNodeLoop
  14++D0B2              ;        ld      (hl),a
  15++D0B2              ;        inc     hl
  16++D0B2              ;        inc     hl
  17++D0B2              ;        dec     ixh
  18++D0B2              ;        jr      nz,ScaleNode
  19++D0B2              ;        ret
  20++D0B2
  21++D0B2
  22++D0B2              InverseXX16:								; lead routine into .LL42	\ ->  &4B04 \ DO nodeX-Ycoords their comment  \  TrnspMat
  23++D0B2              ; we coudl combine this with move to transmat later as an optimisation
  24++D0B2              ; INPUT - All Scaled
  25++D0B2              ;  They transmat has already been put into side, roof nose order
  26++D0B2              ;  XX16   = |sidev_x| |sidev_y| |sidev_z|  1  0  3  2  5  4 note each bytepair is Scaled value in low and high byte just for sign
  27++D0B2              ;  XX16   = |roofv_x| |roofv_y| |roofv_z|  7  6  8  9 11 10
  28++D0B2              ;  XX16   = |nosev_x| |nosev_y| |nosev_z| 13 12 15 14 17 16
  29++D0B2              ; OUTPUT
  30++D0B2              ;  XX16(1 0)   ( 3 2) ( 5 4 ) =  sidev_x roofv_x nosev_x
  31++D0B2              ;  XX16(7 6)   ( 8 9) (11 10) =  sidev_y roofv_y nosev_y
  32++D0B2              ;  XX16(13 12) (15 14)(17 16) =  sidev_z roofv_z nosev_z
  33++D0B2              ; First all side values become compoment 0 of each vector
  34++D0B2 2A 34 C0             ld      hl,(UBnkTransmatSidevX)     ;
  35++D0B5 ED 5B 3A C0          ld      de,(UBnkTransmatRoofvX)     ;
  36++D0B9 ED 4B 40 C0          ld      bc,(UBnkTransmatNosevX)     ;
  37++D0BD 22 4C C0             ld      (UbnkTransInvRow0x0),hl     ;
  38++D0C0 ED 53 4E C0          ld      (UbnkTransInvRow0x1),de     ;
  39++D0C4 ED 43 50 C0          ld      (UbnkTransInvRow0x2),bc     ;
  40++D0C8 2A 36 C0             ld      hl,(UBnkTransmatSidevY)     ;
  41++D0CB ED 5B 3C C0          ld      de,(UBnkTransmatRoofvY)     ;
  42++D0CF ED 4B 42 C0          ld      bc,(UBnkTransmatNosevY)     ;
  43++D0D3 22 54 C0             ld      (UbnkTransInvRow1y0),hl     ;
  44++D0D6 ED 53 56 C0          ld      (UbnkTransInvRow1y1),de     ;
  45++D0DA ED 43 58 C0          ld      (UbnkTransInvRow1y2),bc     ;
  46++D0DE 2A 38 C0             ld      hl,(UBnkTransmatSidevZ)     ;
  47++D0E1 ED 5B 3E C0          ld      de,(UBnkTransmatRoofvZ)     ;
  48++D0E5 ED 4B 44 C0          ld      bc,(UBnkTransmatNosevZ)     ;
  49++D0E9 22 5C C0             ld      (UbnkTransInvRow2z0),hl     ;
  50++D0EC ED 53 5E C0          ld      (UbnkTransInvRow2z1),de     ;
  51++D0F0 ED 43 60 C0          ld      (UbnkTransInvRow2z2),bc     ;
  52++D0F4 C9                   ret
  53++D0F5
  54++D0F5
# file closed: ./Universe/Ships/InverseXX16.asm
 598+ D0F5              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 599+ D0F5              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 600+ D0F5              ;   XX12(1 0) = [x y z] . sidev  = (dot_sidev_sign dot_sidev_lo)  = dot_sidev
 601+ D0F5              ;   XX12(3 2) = [x y z] . roofv  = (dot_roofv_sign dot_roofv_lo)  = dot_roofv
 602+ D0F5              ;   XX12(5 4) = [x y z] . nosev  = (dot_nosev_sign dot_nosev_lo)  = dot_nosev
 603+ D0F5              ; Returns
 604+ D0F5              ;
 605+ D0F5              ;   XX12(1 0)            The dot product of [x y z] vector with the sidev (or _x)
 606+ D0F5              ;                        vector, with the sign in XX12+1 and magnitude in XX12
 607+ D0F5              ;
 608+ D0F5              ;   XX12(3 2)            The dot product of [x y z] vector with the roofv (or _y)
 609+ D0F5              ;                        vector, with the sign in XX12+3 and magnitude in XX12+2
 610+ D0F5              ;
 611+ D0F5              ;   XX12(5 4)            The dot product of [x y z] vector with the nosev (or _z)
 612+ D0F5              ;                        vector, with the sign in XX12+5 and magnitude in XX12+4
 613+ D0F5              XXCURRENTN0equN1byN2div256: MACRO param1, param2, param3
 614+ D0F5 ~                                    ld      c,0
 615+ D0F5 ~                                    ld      a,param3                      ;
 616+ D0F5 ~                                    bit     7,a
 617+ D0F5 ~                                    jr      z,.val2Pos
 618+ D0F5 ~            ;HandleSignebits
 619+ D0F5 ~                                    neg
 620+ D0F5 ~                                    ld      c,$80
 621+ D0F5 ~            .val2Pos:               ld      e,a                         ; use e as var Q = value of XX15 [n] lo
 622+ D0F5 ~                                    ld      a,param2                        ; A = XX16 element
 623+ D0F5 ~                                    bit     7,a
 624+ D0F5 ~                                    jr      z,.val1Pos
 625+ D0F5 ~            ;HandleSignebits
 626+ D0F5 ~                                    neg
 627+ D0F5 ~                                    ld      b,a
 628+ D0F5 ~                                    ld      a,c
 629+ D0F5 ~                                    xor     $80
 630+ D0F5 ~                                    ld      c,a
 631+ D0F5 ~                                    ld      a,b
 632+ D0F5 ~            .val1Pos:               ld      d,a
 633+ D0F5 ~            ;AequAmulQdiv256:
 634+ D0F5 ~                                    mul
 635+ D0F5 ~                                    ld      a,c
 636+ D0F5 ~                                    bit     7,a
 637+ D0F5 ~                                    ld      a,d                         ; we get only the high byte which is like doing a /256 if we think of a as low
 638+ D0F5 ~                                    jr      z,.resultPos
 639+ D0F5 ~                                    neg
 640+ D0F5 ~            .resultPos:             ld      (param1),a                      ; Q         ; result variable = XX16[n] * XX15[n]/256
 641+ D0F5                                      ENDM
 642+ D0F5
 643+ D0F5
 644+ D0F5               ; TESTEDOK
 645+ D0F5              XX12DotOneRow:
 646+ D0F5              XX12CalcX:              N0equN1byN2div256 varT, (hl), (UBnkXScaled)       ; T = (hl) * regXX15fx /256
 646+ D0F5 3A 79 C0    >                        ld      a,(UBnkXScaled)                        ;
 646+ D0F8 5F          >                        ld      e,a                         ; use e as var Q = value of XX15 [n] lo
 646+ D0F9 7E          >                        ld      a,(hl)                        ; A = XX16 element
 646+ D0FA 57          >                        ld      d,a
 646+ D0FB ED 30       >                        mul
 646+ D0FD 7A          >                        ld      a,d                         ; we get only the high byte which is like doing a /256 if we think of a as low
 646+ D0FE 32 DC 97    >                        ld      (varT),a                      ; Q         ; result variable = XX16[n] * XX15[n]/256
 647+ D101 23                                   inc     hl                                  ; move to sign byte
 648+ D102              XX12CalcXSign:          AequN1xorN2 UBnkXScaledSign,(hl)             ;
 648+ D102 3A 7A C0    >                        ld      a,(UBnkXScaledSign)
 648+ D105 AE          >                        xor     (hl)
 649+ D106 32 C1 97                             ld      (varS),a                            ; Set S to the sign of x_sign * sidev_x
 650+ D109 23                                   inc     hl
 651+ D10A              XX12CalcY:              N0equN1byN2div256 varQ, (hl),(UBnkYScaled)       ; Q = XX16 * XX15 /256 using varQ to hold regXX15fx
 651+ D10A 3A 7B C0    >                        ld      a,(UBnkYScaled)                        ;
 651+ D10D 5F          >                        ld      e,a                         ; use e as var Q = value of XX15 [n] lo
 651+ D10E 7E          >                        ld      a,(hl)                        ; A = XX16 element
 651+ D10F 57          >                        ld      d,a
 651+ D110 ED 30       >                        mul
 651+ D112 7A          >                        ld      a,d                         ; we get only the high byte which is like doing a /256 if we think of a as low
 651+ D113 32 BF 97    >                        ld      (varQ),a                      ; Q         ; result variable = XX16[n] * XX15[n]/256
 652+ D116                                      ldCopyByte varT,varR                        ; R = T =  |sidev_x| * x_lo / 256
 652+ D116 3A DC 97    >                        ld       a,(varT)
 652+ D119 32 C0 97    >                        ld       (varR),a
 653+ D11C 23                                   inc     hl
 654+ D11D                                      AequN1xorN2 UBnkYScaledSign,(hl)             ; Set A to the sign of y_sign * sidev_y
 654+ D11D 3A 7C C0    >                        ld      a,(UBnkYScaledSign)
 654+ D120 AE          >                        xor     (hl)
 655+ D121              ; (S)A = |sidev_x| * x_lo / 256  = |sidev_x| * x_lo + |sidev_y| * y_lo
 656+ D121 E5           STequSRplusAQ           push    hl
 657+ D122 CD E1 AE                             call    baddll38                            ; JSR &4812 \ LL38   \ BADD(S)A=R+Q(SA) \ 1byte add (subtract)
 658+ D125 E1                                   pop     hl
 659+ D126 32 DC 97                             ld      (varT),a                            ; T = |sidev_x| * x_lo + |sidev_y| * y_lo
 660+ D129 23                                   inc     hl
 661+ D12A              XX12CalcZ:              N0equN1byN2div256 varQ,(hl),(UBnkZScaled)       ; Q = |sidev_z| * z_lo / 256
 661+ D12A 3A 7D C0    >                        ld      a,(UBnkZScaled)                        ;
 661+ D12D 5F          >                        ld      e,a                         ; use e as var Q = value of XX15 [n] lo
 661+ D12E 7E          >                        ld      a,(hl)                        ; A = XX16 element
 661+ D12F 57          >                        ld      d,a
 661+ D130 ED 30       >                        mul
 661+ D132 7A          >                        ld      a,d                         ; we get only the high byte which is like doing a /256 if we think of a as low
 661+ D133 32 BF 97    >                        ld      (varQ),a                      ; Q         ; result variable = XX16[n] * XX15[n]/256
 662+ D136                                      ldCopyByte varT,varR                        ; R = |sidev_x| * x_lo + |sidev_y| * y_lo
 662+ D136 3A DC 97    >                        ld       a,(varT)
 662+ D139 32 C0 97    >                        ld       (varR),a
 663+ D13C 23                                   inc     hl
 664+ D13D                                      AequN1xorN2 UBnkZScaledSign,(hl)             ; A = sign of z_sign * sidev_z
 664+ D13D 3A 7E C0    >                        ld      a,(UBnkZScaledSign)
 664+ D140 AE          >                        xor     (hl)
 665+ D141              ; (S)A= |sidev_x| * x_lo + |sidev_y| * y_lo + |sidev_z| * z_lo
 666+ D141 CD E1 AE                             call    baddll38                            ; JSR &4812 \ LL38   \ BADD(S)A=R+Q(SA)   \ 1byte add (subtract)
 667+ D144              ; Now we exit with A = result S = Sign
 668+ D144 C9                                   ret
 669+ D145
 670+ D145
 671+ D145              ;-- LL51---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 672+ D145              ;TESTED OK
 673+ D145              XX12EquXX15DotProductXX16:
 674+ D145              XX12EquScaleDotOrientation:                         ; .LL51 \ -> &4832 \ XX12=XX15.XX16  each vector is 16-bit x,y,z
 675+ D145 01 00 00                             ld      bc,0                                ; LDX, LDY 0
 676+ D148 21 34 C0                             ld      hl,UBnkTransmatSidevX
 677+ D14B CD F5 D0                             call    XX12DotOneRow
 678+ D14E 32 7F C0                             ld      (UBnkXX12xLo),a
 679+ D151 3A C1 97                             ld      a,(varS)
 680+ D154 32 80 C0                             ld      (UBnkXX12xSign),a
 681+ D157 21 3A C0                             ld      hl,UBnkTransmatRoofvX
 682+ D15A CD F5 D0                             call    XX12DotOneRow
 683+ D15D 32 81 C0                             ld      (UBnkXX12yLo),a
 684+ D160 3A C1 97                             ld      a,(varS)
 685+ D163 32 82 C0                             ld      (UBnkXX12ySign),a
 686+ D166 21 40 C0                             ld      hl,UBnkTransmatNosevX
 687+ D169 CD F5 D0                             call    XX12DotOneRow
 688+ D16C 32 83 C0                             ld      (UBnkXX12zLo),a
 689+ D16F 3A C1 97                             ld      a,(varS)
 690+ D172 32 84 C0                             ld      (UBnkXX12zSign),a
 691+ D175 C9                                   ret
 692+ D176              ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 693+ D176                                      include "./Universe/Ships/CopyXX12ScaledToXX18.asm"
# file opened: ././Universe/Ships/CopyXX12ScaledToXX18.asm
   1++D176              CopyXX12ScaledToXX18:
   2++D176              CopyResultToDrawCam:
   3++D176                      ldCopyByte XX12         ,XX18             ; XX12+0 => XX18+0  Set XX18(2 0) = dot_sidev

   3++D179 32 6D C0    >                        ld       (XX18),a

   4++D17C 3A 80 C0    >                        ld       a,(XX12+1)

   7++D18E                      ldCopyByte XX12+4       ,XX18+6           ; XX12+4 => XX18+6  Set XX18(8 6) = dot_nosev
   7++D18E 3A 83 C0    >                        ld       a,(XX12+4)

   8++D194 3A 84 C0    >                        ld       a,(XX12+5)
